By joining Jacobs, you'll commit to supporting and engaging with these teams as we work to build a company like no other. <\u002Fp>\n <p>Whether it's for treating water, hosting businesses, or connecting our world, solutions are continuously being implemented. What we do is more than construction; we play a part in moving a vision from concept to reality. We work every day to create the spaces people live in and the infrastructure to improve their lives. If you want to join a company where you can have a tangible impact, join us as an <b>Intermediate Tunneling Contract Administrator<\u002Fb> in our <b>Toronto, ON<\u002Fb> office. <\u002Fp>\n <p>You will have the chance to work on exciting and engaging water and wastewater infrastructure and conveyance projects for our Municipal Clients, where you will utilize your expertise to collaborate with our teams in a safe and efficient delivery – from start to finish. <\u002Fp>\n <p>As an <b>Intermediate Tunneling Contract Administrator<\u002Fb>, you will work as an Owner's representative in the field, on various types of infrastructure and conveyance projects, leading other members of the site inspection and support team. You will coordinate and communicate with all stakeholders on a project, including: client project manager, municipalities, design team, and third parties: regulatory bodies, municipal and federal agencies; testing agencies and laboratories, as well as contractors. <\u002Fp>\n <p>You will ensure construction is in accordance with contract drawings and specifications; manage records of construction activities; prepare reports; keep logs; prepare change orders and payment certificates, keep photo records, etc. You will coordinate and facilitate with engineering design team review of shop drawing; requests for information, site instructions and assist in resolving design\u002Fconstruction issues in the field. You will evaluate, select, and apply company's and client's standards for construction inspections and administration. <\u002Fp>\n <p>If you're up for the challenge, we've been looking for someone just like you. Join our team and help us deliver successful projects.<\u002Fp> \n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <ul> \n  <li>A current licence in good standing with a public body within the province of Ontario, such as Professional Engineers of Ontario (P.Eng.) (preferred) or The Ontario Association of Certified Engineering Technicians and Technologists - Certified Engineering Technologist (C.E.T.)<\u002Fli> \n  <li>University degree or Engineering technology diploma or demonstrated experience <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Minimum of 12 years of linear conveyance construction administration experience is required.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Minimum of 6 years prior experience on tunneling projects is preferred. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Municipal client project experience is required<\u002Fli> \n  <li>High capital value project or program experience preferred<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to effectively communicate with clients and contractors <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Ability to tolerate outdoor weather conditions in summer and winter. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Experience working in the GTA is strongly preferred <\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>Ideally you'll also have:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Engineering and heavy construction experience in municipal infrastructure and conveyance projects<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Proven track record of delivering heavy construction projects on time and within budget<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Demonstrated ability to direct and\u002For supervise project teams <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Foresight and balanced judgement in anticipating and solving problems during construction. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Worked as owner's representative in managing construction contracts including; acting as the primary point of contract, preparing payments, change orders, request for information, schedule review and oversight, time extensions, and certificates of completion. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Preparation and distribution of weekly reports<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Participate and run effective daily\u002Fweekly CM meetings<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Participate in Project Workshops, Client and Construction meetings<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Valid driver's license and a car to drive to the sites <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Ability to work at heights <\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <i>At Jacobs, we’re challenging today to reinvent tomorrow by solving the world’s most critical problems for thriving cities, resilient environments, mission-critical outcomes, operational advancement, scientific discovery and cutting-edge manufacturing, turning abstract ideas into realities that transform the world for good. <p><i>Our People &amp; Places Solutions business – reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomizes the \"why\" of what we do – the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole. As a wildlife biologist, you will provide technical direction and support for the wildlife biology components of our challenging natural resource projects. Pave the way for your career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow. You'll impact the world around you by helping us solve real-life challenges. <\u002Fp>\n <p>Based throughout Western Canada, this position will begin as a 6 – 9 month contract with opportunity for extension or transfer into full-time. You’ll have the opportunity to work as part of multi-disciplinary project teams associated with our Western Canada Offices to contribute to the environmental planning, permitting, and construction support efforts of government and privately-owned infrastructure projects. As an <b>Entry-Level Biologist<\u002Fb> with a focus on wildlife, you’ll have the opportunity to be mentored and support field work for wildlife surveys, but also field work for other biophysical disciplines as needed. Bring your enthusiasm for learning and desire to conserve our natural resources, and we’ll help you grow!<\u002Fp> \n <p>At Jacobs, we’re partnering across the globe to create the best project outcomes by maximizing the design, digital technology, and support capabilities of our Global Integrated Delivery (GID) teammates. degree or diploma in biology or other environmental discipline (or near completion), primarily related to wildlife, or equivalent demonstrated experience<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n identification and surveys, and amphibian identification and surveys in western Canada<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>Positive attitude and self-motivated to learn and develop as a valuable team member <\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <ul>\n  <li>Strong consideration for safety during your work<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>Excellent interpersonal skills, team-oriented, and suited to <p><i>Our People &amp; Places Solutions business – reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomizes the \"why\" of what we do – the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole. From facilities delivering life-saving therapies and ensuring clean water to enabling the connection of people through all modes of transportation and providing access to technology – we're integrating a multitude of these solution elements to build the smart environments of tomorrow.<\u002Fi><br> <br> <i>Start your Jacobs career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <br> \n <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> We are looking for environmental professionals who have an interest in Project Management to join our amazing team of Project Managers at Jacobs. <\u002Fp>\n <p>Based in British Columbia or Alberta, you will support the management of projects, and be placed on a training track to manage your own projects related to environmental, regulatory, permitting, construction or maintenance for capital projects. Working with senior Project Managers, you will be responsible for meeting internal and external client objectives and project-specific internal financial goals. You will be challenged to support and build efficient delivery teams that produce high quality work and to develop client relationships that facilitate expanding the depth and breadth of our services. All of this will be accomplished in a supportive team setting, with help and guidance from fellow Project Managers, operations mentors, client account managers, and talent supervisors. Global technical practice leaders will assist you to bring the right tools and approaches and newest innovations to our clients. You will work with a team of almost 200 natural and cultural resource professionals and planners, supporting projects throughout Western Canada.<\u002Fp> \n <p>At Jacobs, we’re partnering across the globe to create the best project outcomes by maximizing the design, digital technology, and support capabilities of our Global Integrated Delivery teammates. By joining Jacobs, you’ll commit to supporting and engaging with these teams, as we work to build a company like no other.<\u002Fp> \n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <ul> \n  <li>Bachelor’s degree in an environmental-related field<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Exposure to project management tasks (budget preparation &amp; tracking, schedule, task management, team management) on environmental projects in British Columbia or Alberta<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience in environmental consulting in western Canada<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, excited to work in a multi-disciplinary team environment<\u002Fli> \n  <li>High attention to detail<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Interest in inspiring and supporting the development of others through high quality delivery for our clients.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p>Ideally, you will also have:<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Relevant experience working as a consultant on infrastructure projects in Western Canada<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Knowledge of some provincial and federal environmental legislation and regulatory requirements in Western Canada<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Some experience serving as assistant project manager, or project management of small projects<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Technical writing skills<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <i>At Jacobs, we’re challenging today to reinvent tomorrow by solving the world’s most critical problems for thriving cities, resilient environments, mission-critical outcomes, operational advancement, scientific discovery and cutting-edge manufacturing, turning abstract ideas into realities that transform the world for good. <p><i>Our People &amp; Places Solutions business – reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomizes the \"why\" of what we do – the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole. From facilities delivering life-saving therapies and ensuring clean water to enabling the connection of people through all modes of transportation and providing access to technology – we're integrating a multitude of these solution elements to build the smart environments of tomorrow.<\u002Fi><br> <br> <i>Start your Jacobs career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <br> \n <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> At Jacobs, we’re partnering across the globe to create the best project outcomes by maximizing the design, digital technology, and support capabilities of our Global Integrated Delivery (GID) teammates. By joining Jacobs, you’ll commit to supporting and engaging with these teams, as we work to build a company like no other.<\u002Fp> \n <p>We are looking for<b> Intermediate\u002FSenior Contract Administrators<\u002Fb> for a number of municipal waste water facilities for our Municipal Clients, based out of our Toronto, ON office.<\u002Fp> \n <p>As a <b>Contract Administrator<\u002Fb>, you will work as an Owner’s representative in the field, on various types of waste water facilities projects, leading other members of the site inspection and support team. You will coordinate and communicate with all stakeholders on a project, including: client project manager, municipalities, design team, pre-purchased equipment suppliers; and third parties: regulatory bodies, municipal and federal agencies; testing agencies and laboratories, as well as contractors.<\u002Fp> \n <p>You will ensure construction is in accordance with contract drawings and specifications; manage records of construction activities; prepare reports; keep logs; prepare change orders and payment certificates, keep photo records, etc. You will coordinate and facilitate with engineering design team review of shop drawing; requests for information; site instructions and assist in resolving design\u002Fconstruction issues in the field. You will evaluate, select, and apply company’s and client’s standards for construction inspections and administration.<\u002Fp> \n <p>If you’re up for the challenge, we’ve been looking for someone just like you. Join our team and help us deliver successful projects.<\u002Fp> \n <p>You must have:<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Engineering and heavy construction experience in municipal waste water facilities<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Contract administration of large and complex infrastructure projects, 35M+<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Strong knowledge of means and methods of construction for different waste water processes<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Proven track record of delivering heavy construction projects on time and within budget<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Demonstrated ability to direct and\u002F or supervise project teams comprised of 5+ staff<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Foresight and balanced judgement in anticipating and solving problems during construction.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Worked as owner's representative in managing construction contracts including: acting as primary point of contract, preparing payments, change orders, time extensions, and certificates of completion.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Performed constructability, tendering, schedule, and budget reviews at preconstruction phases of the project.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Valid driver’s license and a car to drive to the sites<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to work at heights<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <ul> \n  <li>University degree or Engineering technology diploma or demonstrated experience<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Minimum of 10 years construction administration experience is required; prior experience on municipal Wastewater facilities <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Ability to effectively communicate with clients and contractors<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to tolerate outdoors weather conditions in summer and winter.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience working in the GTA is strongly preferred<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p>You are Jacobs’ face to the client and public during construction, and as such you have demonstrated strengths in respectful communication, problem solving, and a love for working with people and getting things done. As a wildlife biologist, you will provide technical direction and support for the wildlife biology components of our challenging natural resource projects. Pave the way for your career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow. You'll impact the world around you by helping us solve real-life challenges. <\u002Fp>\n <p>Based throughout Western Canada, this position will begin as a 6 – 9 month contract with opportunity for extension or transfer into full-time. You’ll have the opportunity to work as part of multi-disciplinary project teams associated with our Western Canada Offices to contribute to the environmental planning, permitting, and construction support efforts of government and privately-owned infrastructure projects. As an <b>Entry-Level Biologist<\u002Fb> with a focus on wildlife, you’ll have the opportunity to be mentored and support field work for wildlife surveys, but also field work for other biophysical disciplines as needed. Bring your enthusiasm for learning and desire to conserve our natural resources, and we’ll help you grow!<\u002Fp> \n <p>At Jacobs, we’re partnering across the globe to create the best project outcomes by maximizing the design, digital technology, and support capabilities of our Global Integrated Delivery (GID) teammates. You will be challenged to support and build efficient delivery teams that produce high quality work and to develop client relationships that facilitate expanding the depth and breadth of our services. All of this will be accomplished in a supportive team setting, with help and guidance from fellow Project Managers, operations mentors, client account managers, and talent supervisors. Global technical practice leaders will assist you to bring the right tools and approaches and newest innovations to our clients. You will work with a team of almost 200 natural and cultural resource professionals and planners, supporting projects throughout Western Canada.<\u002Fp> \n <p>At Jacobs, we’re partnering across the globe to create the best project outcomes by maximizing the design, digital technology, and support capabilities of our Global Integrated Delivery teammates. <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> At Client Deliverables Solutions (CDS), we help our project teams tell the story of the work we do at Jacobs. Our professional editing and publishing services bring life to project communications and present technical information in an approachable, understandable way. From multi-volume regulatory submittals to simple memos and project reports, CDS partners with project teams to develop and deliver quality, consistent, and cost-effective publications that demonstrate how Jacobs is challenging today and reinventing tomorrow. Start your Jacobs career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.<\u002Fp> \n <p>At Jacobs, we don’t settle – we’re always looking beyond to raise the bar and deliver with excellence. We apply our expertise and knowledge as we look to the future with great optimism and focus.<\u002Fp> \n <p>We’re looking for a talented, highly motivated, and energetic Document Publisher to join our team of creatives in North America (currently in a remote capacity). You’ll be part of a thriving, collaborative, inclusive team, delivering professional documents to our internal and external clients. You’ll engage with publishing colleagues to create and refine project documentation into clean, clear, attractive publications, following company standards and client requirements. A Document Publisher’s diverse range of skills includes creating and using custom templates, applying Jacobs branded styles as appropriate, document formatting, proofreading text for spelling or grammatical errors, and simple graphic development and page layout. A Document Publisher often will work on a document from conception to production and delivery.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Bring your curiosity, talent for multi-tasking and collaboration, and extreme organizational skills and we’ll help you grow, pursue and fulfill what drives you – so we can make big impacts on the world, together.<\u002Fp> \n <p>LI-Remote<\u002Fp> \n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <ul> \n  <li>Expertise formatting in Microsoft Word (MS), Excel, and PowerPoint according to established company brand or project-specific styles and template requirements<\u002Fli> \n  <li>MS Word: Expert knowledge creating and applying Word templates, manipulating styles, using mail merge, creating and using macros, section breaks, page layout, cross-references, tracked changes, and troubleshooting document formatting issues<\u002Fli> \n  <li>MS Excel: Basic knowledge of formatting a spreadsheet, formulas, and manipulating graphs and charts<\u002Fli> \n  <li>MS PowerPoint: Basic knowledge of how to apply formatting to an established template<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Expertise in Adobe publishing programs \n   <ul>\n    <li>Acrobat: Expert knowledge of creating complex PDFs of reports that include multiple figures, tables, and appendixes for client review<\u002Fli> \n    <li>InDesign, Illustrator, and Photoshop: Basic knowledge is a plus but not required<\u002Fli> \n   <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n  <li>Understanding of a wide variety of shared workspace platforms (SharePoint, ProjectWise, etc.), document-related software techniques, visual mediums, and delivery options<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience working as part of a team and collaborating with editorial, graphic design, document publishing, production, and technical staff<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Demonstrated time management skills, to include completing work on time, communicating your current workload and upcoming availability, scheduling your participation on long-term projects, and efficiently offloading work to your colleagues if you’re overbooked<\u002Fli> \n  <li>A commitment to providing the best quality work you can in the time provided for the work, to include engaging in quality reviews and implementing feedback<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Flexibility to work occasional evenings and weekends when our success depends on you<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p>Ideally, you’ll also have:<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Bachelor's degree; relevant job experience may be accepted in lieu of degree<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Understanding of grammatical rules, punctuation, and references and citations.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience with best practices for document accessibility (Section 508, AODA, WCAG, PDF\u002FUA)<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience in an engineering consulting environment<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <br> \n <p><i>At Jacobs, we’re challenging today to reinvent tomorrow by solving the world’s most critical problems for thriving cities, resilient environments, mission-critical outcomes, operational advancement, scientific discovery and cutting-edge manufacturing, turning abstract ideas into realities that transform the world for good. With $13 billion in revenue and a talent force of more than 55,000, Jacobs provides a full spectrum of professional services including consulting, technical, scientific and project delivery for the government and private <p><i>Our People &amp; Places Solutions business – reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomizes the \"why\" of what we do – the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole. From facilities delivering life-saving therapies and ensuring clean water to enabling the connection of people through all modes of transportation and providing access to technology – we're integrating a multitude of these solution elements to build the smart environments of tomorrow.<\u002Fi><br> <br> <i>Start your Jacobs career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <br> \n <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> At Jacobs, we’re partnering across the globe to create the best project outcomes by maximizing the design, digital technology, and support capabilities of our Global Integrated Delivery (GID) teammates. By joining Jacobs, you’ll commit to supporting and engaging with these teams, as we work to build a company like no other.<br> <\u002Fp>\n <p>Support our Digital Delivery\u002FBIM team and have a hand in transforming tomorrow! Successful candidates will be focused on project and program delivery for clients across Canada. Successful candidates will be responsible for assisting in the delivery of projects, working with design and production teams located in multiple offices across our region. The successful candidate will thrive in a team environment, interact with teams in multiple offices, assist project\u002Fdesign managers, manage BIM applications as well as being responsible for drawing production and BIM deliverables.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>Responsibilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>Digital Delivery<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Work closely with the Regional Technology Lead and BIM managers to help coordinate BIM collaboration and project delivery.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Be responsible for project BIM organization, drawing production, and BIM-CADD standard enforcement on a variety of assignments.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Work closely with BIM managers and BIM Designers to help deliver quality project deliverables.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Provide Projectwise and BIM360 Common Data Environment (CDE) configuration and management.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Provide oversight and coordination regarding BIM software, modeling technique, digital workflows and procedures.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Coordinating project BIM-CAD delivery within the Engineering Technical Execution Plan guidance.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Other duties as required.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p>Model Management<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Organize and manage project BIM-CAD files in the associated CDE.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Define workflows and develop work instructions for project team direction.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Develop project specific BIM-CAD template files and discipline BIM content and configurations.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Assist discipline BIM leads with software configuration, content creation and data management.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Implement Client standards and project workflows to accommodate Client specific BIM-CAD and Data deliverables.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Develop and manage the federated project model for design, clash and quality review.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Host design coordination sessions with design management and discipline leads. Perform interference checking, O&amp;M review, and model quality control.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Other duties as required.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p>Drawing Management<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Prepare drawing packages for QA-QC reviews and Client submissions.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Develop cross discipline general drawings, general legends, submission index and cover sheets.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Develop project specific drawing borders for associated software.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Manage Title block and Revision data integrations with in the CDE.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Document control for all design stage deliverables and archives.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Provide drawing\u002Fmodeling progress updates and quality audits.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Other duties as required.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p>Digital Solutions<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Work with the Digital Delivery team to implement and expand on our suite of project lifecycle digital solutions.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Utilize virtual and augmented reality solutions for design and client review.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Manage the collection, formatting, and project distribution of Point Cloud data.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Coordinate model properties for 4D schedule integration and construction sequencing.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Coordinate model properties for 5D quantity take off and cost estimating.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Planning and development of BIM integrated asset data and documentation collection.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Develop project specific review and approval automations within the CDE.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Planning and management of record models for project lifecycle and client information handover.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Other duties as required.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <ul> \n  <li>Post-secondary education in Architectural\u002FStructural\u002FMechanical\u002FCivil\u002FConstruction Technology, or an equivalent combination of education and experience.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Being and active member of OACETT \u002FCAN-BIM or eligible to become a member is an asset.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>4-8 years’ experience in delivering facility designs within a BIM digital environment.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to establish close working relationship with project delivery teams, illustrating knowledge of BIM processes as they pertain to collaboration, coordination, and digital delivery.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>High level of organizational skills with a good attitude, strong leadership skills and excellent time management skills.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Able to work in a deadline driven, fast-paced environment.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Willingness to learn new software, products, concepts, techniques and help develop new practices and standards.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <ul>\n  <li>Strong technical skills related to BIM and CADD standards, and automation.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <ul>\n  <li>Ability to prepare electronic drawing files within project standards, using 3D modeling, sketches, layouts, project instructions and notes.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Possess a strong working knowledge of CAD drafting and BIM practices (NCS, AIA, CSI, NIBS, ISO19650)<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Working knowledge in Autodesk REVIT, discipline specific configurations, templates, and family content creation is required.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Working knowledge with Bentley OpenBuildings, OpenPlant and OpenRoads Designer would be an asset.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Working knowledge of AutoCAD and Microstation is required.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience managing a project Common Data Environment; Bentley Projectwise and Autodesk BIM360.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience working with multi-discipline teams.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <ul>\n  <li>Experience with Autodesk Navisworks is required, exposure to Bentley iTwin would be an asset.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience with Bluebeam and Bluebeam Studio is an asset.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <ul>\n  <li>Able to set priorities and manage change to meet business needs and project schedules, while managing multiple BIM projects concurrently.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <ul>\n  <li>Excellent verbal, communication, and problem-solving skills, with strong attention to detail is a must.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <ul>\n  <li>Working knowledge of Windows O\u002FS and Microsoft Office is required.<\u002Fli> \n You'll impact the world around you by helping us solve real-life challenges.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Based out of your home office in Calgary or Edmonton, you’ll work as part of our wetlands team to contribute to the environmental planning and permitting efforts of government and privately-owned infrastructure projects. You will have the opportunity to support projects through field data collection efforts, and assisting with the development of technical reports, review of field data, data management and regulatory applications as needed. This flex contract position will be a 7-month contract with an anticipated 75% of travel for fieldwork and 25% office work. Potential for contract extension based on performance and anticipated workload. By joining Jacobs, you’ll commit to supporting and engaging with these teams, as we work to build a company like no other. <\u002Fp>\n <p>Your initial role will be to undertake field reviews, field inspections, and structural calculations on a variety of road and transit structures. Following an initial training period your role will progressively grow to include supporting our business development and project delivery teams. The incumbent should be willing to work in a team environment, interact with clients and approval agencies, and assist project\u002Flead engineers in their deliverables.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>Responsibilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>Report to Project\u002FLead Engineer and perform design and inspection tasks including:<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Undertake structural site investigations to support design.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Undertake bridge, culvert, dam and retaining wall inspections.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Perform miscellaneous field reviews during construction.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Perform miscellaneous design calculation and calculation checks.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Perform structural evaluations.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Review local standards and develop site specific non-standard specifications.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Produce technical reports and memos to support design.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Works closely with Project\u002FLead Engineer during all phases of project planning, execution, and closeout.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Develop engineering sketches.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Work with technologist to develop drawings.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Other duties as required.<\u002Fli> \n training requirements for rail and transit vehicle or subsystem procurements or overhauls.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Perform and assist with technical reviews of vehicle and subsystem design for transit bus and railroad fleets, analyze requirements, and prepare review comments for disposition of Contract Deliverables.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Perform oversight and witnessing of factory testing of vehicles and subsystems prior to approval for shipment; <p><i>Our People &amp; Places Solutions business – reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomizes the \"why\" of what we do – the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole. From facilities delivering life-saving therapies and ensuring clean water to enabling the connection of people through all modes of transportation and providing access to technology – we're integrating a multitude of these solution elements to build the smart environments of tomorrow.<\u002Fi><br> <br> <i>Start your Jacobs career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <br> \n <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> At Jacobs, we’re partnering across the globe to create the best project outcomes by maximizing the design, digital technology, and support capabilities of our Global Integrated Delivery (GID) teammates. By joining Jacobs, you’ll commit to supporting and engaging with these teams, as we work to build a company like no other.<\u002Fp> \n <p>When it comes to environmental consulting, we’re helping our clients protect our world’s natural resources. As a wetland specialist, you will too. Pave the way for your career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow. You'll impact the world around you by helping us solve real-life challenges.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Based out of your home office in British Columbia, you’ll work as part of our wetlands team to contribute to the environmental planning and permitting efforts of government and privately-owned infrastructure projects. You will have the opportunity to support projects through field data collection efforts, and assisting with the development of technical reports, review of field data, data management and regulatory applications as needed. This flex contract position will be a 7-month contract with an anticipated 70% of travel for fieldwork and 30% office work. Potential for contract extension based on performance and anticipated workload. Bring your enthusiasm for learning and desire to conserve our natural resources, and we’ll help you grow!<\u002Fp> \n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <ul> \n  <li>Diploma, B.Sc. or M.Sc. in biology, related to ecology, hydrology, wetlands, botany, or equivalent demonstrated experience<\u002Fli> \n  <li>At least 1-3 years of relevant field experience in environmental consulting<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Proven field skills and willingness to work in the field in remote locations for extended periods of time if required<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience in satellite imagery interpretation, classification and delineation of wetlands in the field in British Columbia<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience using ArcGIS software <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Strong skills in identification of vegetation in British Columbia<\u002Fli> \n  <li>A driver’s license and a clean driver’s abstract<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>Ideally, you’ll also have:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Experience or interest to support other biophysical study areas such as reclamation, vegetation, wildlife, soils, and\u002For fisheries field assessments.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <i>At Jacobs, we’re challenging today to reinvent tomorrow by solving the world’s most critical problems for thriving cities, resilient environments, mission-critical outcomes, operational advancement, scientific discovery and cutting-edge manufacturing, turning abstract ideas into realities that transform the world for good. With $13 billion in revenue and a talent force of more than 55,000, Jacobs provides a full spectrum of professional services including consulting, technical, scientific and project delivery for the government and private <p><i>Our People &amp; Places Solutions business – reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomizes the \"why\" of what we do – the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole. From facilities delivering life-saving therapies and ensuring clean water to enabling the connection of people through all modes of transportation and providing access to technology – we're integrating a multitude of these solution elements to build the smart environments of tomorrow.<\u002Fi><br> <br> <i>Start your Jacobs career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <br> \n <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> Join our team at Jacobs, a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.<\u002Fp> \n <p>We are seeking a <b>Hydrogeological and Geological Engineering Specialist<\u002Fb> to support our team here in <b>Toronto<\u002Fb>. You’ll have the opportunity to follow projects from concept through completion. You’ll have the opportunity to gain valuable experience with design assignments in hydrogeology, engineering geology and geological engineering which will contribute to your success as you grow your career.<\u002Fp> \n <p>As a <b>Hydrogeological and Geological Engineering Specialist<\u002Fb>, you’ll have the chance to perform a variety of hydrogeological and geotechnical field investigation and engineering analysis, reporting and design work for hydrogeological and geotechnical projects. Working with other members of the team, you’ll perform routine aspects of engineering and geoscience assignments requiring knowledge and application of geotechnical engineering and hydrogeology principles.<\u002Fp> \n <p>You will use prescribing methods, as well as perform specific and limited portions of engineering and geoscience assignments. If you’re up for the challenge, we’ve been looking for someone just like you. Join our team and help us lay the foundation for human progress.<\u002Fp> \n <p>The responsibilities will include a varied range of hydrogeological and geotechnical tasks and will generally include but not be limited to the following:<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Report to senior hydrogeologists, geotechnical engineers, and project managers, supporting them in proposal preparation, scope of work development, and client deliverables.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Client and regulatory liaison, as appropriate.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Under minimal supervision, perform hydrogeological and geotechnical investigations including collation and quality management of environmental, hydrogeological, and geotechnical data, analysis of data, and report writing.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Provide oversight and supervision of subcontractors and subconsultants including but not limited to drillers, geophysical contractors, surveyors, and waste disposal contractors.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Perform field work on integrated hydrogeological and geotechnical programs to include supervision of borehole drilling, monitoring well installation, geologic and geotechnical logging, aquifer testing (slug tests, pumping tests, packer tests), installation of grouted vibrating wire piezometers, groundwater sampling, and other field tasks as required;<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Complete rigorous and clear field documentation and participate in planning, organizing, and reporting related to field tasks<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Acquire and maintain appropriate safety training to conduct geotechnical and hydrogeological work.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Assist with the development of conceptual and numerical geological and hydrogeological models for municipal water supplies, source water protection, mining, water resource studies, and dewatering assessments for Permit to Take Water studies;<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Support the development of client relationships either through project-based client interaction, assisting with maintaining and developing relationships with those clients or through supporting business development efforts of senior staff;<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Contribute to a positive and collaborative working environment, and encouraging the contribution of ideas to continuously improve projects and processes;<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Work in a collaborative manner with multidisciplinary colleagues in Canada and internationally.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p>Prior experience with the following is considered a bonus for this position:<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Design and coordination of hydrogeological and geotechnical field investigation and monitoring programs.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Field work associated with hydrogeological projects, including municipal ground water supply investigations, construction dewatering, and water resource studies;<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Groundwater and surface water sampling using a variety of methods.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience undertaking field work including: • oversight of a variety of drilling methods (hollow and solid stem auger, sonic, reverse circulation, downhole hammer, mud and air rotary, wireline coring), logging of overburden and bedrock, and preparation of borehole logs using gINT and OpenGround.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>monitoring well and municipal supply well construction oversight, aquifer hydraulic testing (e.g., slug tests, packer tests, and pumping tests).<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Interpretation of analytical results for soil, bedrock, surface water and groundwater samples with respect to Federal and Provincial guidelines and standards, and industry best practice.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Geological, geotechnical and hydrogeological interpretation for the development of 3D geological models, and cross sections.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience with standard hydrogeological and geotechnical software including but not limited to Leapfrog Works, AQTESOLV, AquiferWin32, Groundwater Vistas, FEFLOW, SEEP\u002FW, SLOPE\u002FW, Surfer, EVS, PLAXIS, gINT, OpenGround, Global Mapper\u002FArcGIS, Python;<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <ul> \n  <li>Bachelor’s (B.Sc. or B.A.Sc.) or Master’s degree (M.Sc.\u002FM.Eng.) in geological engineering, engineering geology, geotechnical engineering, geology, or hydrogeology with the prerequisites allowing eligibility for E.I.T.\u002FP.Eng. licensing. Or G.I.T.\u002FP.Geo.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>2 to 4 years’ documented Canadian market work experience (Ontario experience an asset) in hydrogeology and geological engineering\u002Fgeotechnical engineering.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Solid understanding of engineering geology, geotechnical engineering including soil mechanics, and physical hydrogeology.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Must be willing and have the ability to travel for short to medium term assignments (within Canada and internationally) with occasional overnight travel and flexibility to work outside normal business hours as required. Requirement to travel and participate in remote field work, and the ability to adapt to unpredictable and\u002For inclement field conditions and changing schedules.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Must have excellent verbal and written communication skills (English)<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Valid Canadian driver’s license.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Proven report writing skills;<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to display initiative and engage decision making skills.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Enthusiasm for geotechnical and geological engineering, and hydrogeology, demonstrating a desire and commitment to Continued Professional Development;<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Knowledgeable of Federal and Provincial\u002FTerritorial Environmental Acts and Regulations in Canada.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Must hold or be able to obtain a Canadian ‘Reliability Status’ Federal security clearance.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p>#LI-Hybrid<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <br> \n <i>At Jacobs, we’re challenging today to reinvent tomorrow by solving the world’s most critical problems for thriving cities, resilient environments, mission-critical outcomes, operational advancement, scientific discovery and cutting-edge manufacturing, turning abstract ideas into realities that transform the world for good. With $13 billion in revenue and a talent force of more than 55,000, Jacobs provides a full spectrum of professional services including consulting, technical, scientific and project delivery for the government and private <p><i>Our People &amp; Places Solutions business – reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomizes the \"why\" of what we do – the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole. From facilities delivering life-saving therapies and ensuring clean water to enabling the connection of people through all modes of transportation and providing access to technology – we're integrating a multitude of these solution elements to build the smart environments of tomorrow.<\u002Fi><br> <br> <i>Start your Jacobs career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <br> \n <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> At Jacobs, we’re partnering across the globe to create the best project outcomes by maximizing the design, digital technology, and support capabilities of our Global Integrated Delivery (GID) teammates. By joining Jacobs, you’ll commit to supporting and engaging with these teams, as we work to build a company like no other.<\u002Fp> \n <p>As a <b>Locomotive Overhaul and Procurement Engineer<\u002Fb>, you’ll be a part of diverse multi-disciplinary teams allowing you to both share what you know and learn so you can grow. Join us and we will assist you in continued development of your skills and exploring all that you can do across our global company.<\u002Fp> \n <p>You’ll provide engineering and program management support for a variety of locomotive projects, working with other members of our team, supporting: the specification, and oversight of design, manufacturing and commissioning of rail vehicles, with a focus on diesel-electric and electric locomotives, but also including other vehicle types; monitor and manage the design of new vehicles and electrical or mechanical parts; supervise modifications and resolve technical problems; and advise on maintenance activities.<\u002Fp> \n <p>You’ll be tasked with answering technical and commercial questions from clients as well as leading junior team members with day-to-day functions related to rolling stock engineering.<\u002Fp> \n <p>We’ll ask you to work on projects that will include consulting services for the procurement of overhauled and remanufactured diesel locomotives and new electric locomotives, as well as other rail vehicles and related projects. As a key team member, you will be involved with design review, project management, manufacturing oversight, field implementation and testing activities . You’ll have opportunities to communicate and interact with locomotive and subsystem manufacturers and contractors to resolve technical issues. We’ll rely on you to support the wider team with preparation of technical reports on complex technical equipment problems, failure trends and fleet reliability issues, as well as investigate any part failures or maintenance issues. You will be part of a team that will use judgement-based experiences to evaluate situations and develop solutions, while working independently to achieve individual assignment outcomes while managing your personal workload.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Based in Toronto, the position requires presence on client sites at least 50% of the time, and will require intermittent periods of short term travel to supplier facilities. Hybrid work schedules are possible.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>You will also be asked to perform the following:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>Complete work to the satisfaction of our clients, while simultaneously ensuring that Jacob’s HS&amp;E, quality, financial, risk management, business and policy expectations are met.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Work with project delivery leadership who provide oversight and mentoring. Support the development of team members, regardless of individual experiences (both technical and non-technical) through active coaching and mentoring<\u002Fp> \n <p>Support business development activities leading to the award of further contracts. This typically includes client relationship development, project-specific position activities, proposal preparation, orals presentation, and contract negotiation consistent with established business development processes.<\u002Fp> \n <p>May execute special or continuous research in support of a project, collect data and analyze complex problems associated with a project, or departmental projects. For example, being part of a team that may propose and\u002For evaluate proposed system improvements with regards to availability of proven technologies in the market, risk, cost, integration, and configuration constraints of rail vehicles such as space envelope, power, etc.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>Specific job duties will include:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Provide project management and technical support to a variety of rail vehicle assignments. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Provide Engineering and project management support in preparation of technical specifications for functional\u002F sub system\u002F testing\u002F maintenance &amp; training requirements for rail vehicle or subsystem procurements or overhauls.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Perform technical reviews of vehicle and subsystem design for transit and railroad fleets, analyze requirements, and prepare review comments for disposition of Contract Deliverables.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Perform oversight and witnessing of factory testing of vehicles and subsystems prior to approval for shipment; log discrepancies and prepare reports for status of system testing.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Monitor field implementation and testing activities for a range of rail vehicles. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Support System integration of vehicle subsystems and complete vehicles from different suppliers for compatibility and functional performance.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Assess performance and specification compliance for vehicles and subsystems.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Administrative matters, as work needs are identified, and responsibilities are delegated.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p><i>You’ll be working mainly from home (unless you prefer coming into the office), with the expectation to travel for client \u002Fsite meetings and occasional team meetings.<\u002Fi><br> <\u002Fp>\n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <ul> \n  <li>Bachelor of Applied Science\u002FEngineering (or equivalent academic qualification or industry experience)<\u002Fli> \n  <li>10 years’ experience in the rail industry, with some experience involving operations, maintenance, purchase and\u002For design of equipment which follows AAR, FRA, APTA PRESS and\u002For Transport Canada standards.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience with locomotives (diesel electric and\u002For catenary electric), that includes engineering, manufacturing, testing, commissioning, operations and maintenance. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Familiarity with rail vehicle industry standards, systems, and practices.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to read, understand, comment on and contribute to technical specifications, engineering drawings and reports, and maintenance manuals.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Demonstrated Project Management Experience.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Excellent written and verbal communications skills, and the ability to communicate technical information to non-technical audiences.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Proficient with the Microsoft Office Suite.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>Preferred Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Experience in multiple project areas and projects.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience with GM-EMD equipment. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>EIT, PEng, PMP or a demonstrated desire to pursue.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p>#LI-Hybrid<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <br> \n <i>At Jacobs, we’re challenging today to reinvent tomorrow by solving the world’s most critical problems for thriving cities, resilient environments, mission-critical outcomes, operational advancement, scientific discovery and cutting-edge manufacturing, turning abstract ideas into realities that transform the world for good. With $13 billion in revenue and a talent force of more than 55,000, Jacobs provides a full spectrum of professional services including consulting, technical, scientific and project delivery for the government and private <p><i>Our People &amp; Places Solutions business – reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomizes the \"why\" of what we do – the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole. From facilities delivering life-saving therapies and ensuring clean water to enabling the connection of people through all modes of transportation and providing access to technology – we're integrating a multitude of these solution elements to build the smart environments of tomorrow.<\u002Fi><br> <br> <i>Start your Jacobs career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <br> \n <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> When it comes to environmental consulting, we’re helping our clients protect our world’s natural resources. As a <b>Field Aquatic Biologist<\u002Fb>, you will provide technical direction and support on the aquatic biology and water resource permitting components of our challenging natural resource projects, as well as coordination and guidance to our team of field biologists.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Based throughout western Canada, this position will start as a 6 to 9-month contract position (with the possibility of extension), this position will be primarily field based with some office work. You’ll have the chance to work as part of multi-disciplinary project teams to contribute directly to the environmental planning and permitting and efforts of government and privately-owned infrastructure projects throughout Canada. You will provide technical support for the duration of the life of the projects. You will have the opportunity to support the execution of the work including data collection efforts, as well as assist with the development of methodology, technical reports, and regulatory applications. This is a science-based role, and the successful candidate will have a known reputation in the industry as a technical expert and has shown ability to defend the technical rigor of the work completed. Bring your enthusiasm for learning and desire to conserve our natural resources, and we’ll help you grow!<\u002Fp> \n <p>At Jacobs, we’re partnering across the globe to create the best project outcomes by maximizing the design, digital technology, and support capabilities of our Global Integrated Delivery (GID) teammates. By joining Jacobs, you’ll commit to supporting and engaging with these teams, as we continuously work to build a company like no other.<\u002Fp> \n <p>#ges23<\u002Fp> \n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <ul>\n  <li><br> B.Sc. or M.Sc degree in fish or aquatic-related studies with relevant experience conducting and managing aquatic studies (such as fish and fish habitat assessments, water quality monitoring, fish sampling, etc.).<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>Previous experience conducting aquatics field work, directing and\u002For managing aquatic crews in remote settings.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>Valid Electro-fishing certificate approved by Worksafe BC (https:\u002F\u002Fwww.worksafebc.com\u002Fen\u002Fhealth-safety\u002Feducation-training-certification\u002Felectrofishing-operator).<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>Relevant oil and gas and regulatory experience.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>Hold or be eligible for Professional Designation under the BC College of Applied Biology and\u002For the Alberta Society of Professional Biologists.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>Must have driver’s license and clean driver’s abstract.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p>Ideally, You’ll Also Have:<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Previous consulting experience with experience working with a diverse range of industrial clients.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>Working knowledge of the Federal Fisheries Act and other relevant provincial and federal environmental legislation in western Canada.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>Time management skills, with the ability to simultaneously work on multiple tasks\u002Fprojects and meet project deadlines.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>Experience in client liaison and business development.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>Detail oriented with excellent data capture and recording skills.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>Positive attitude, self-motivated with strong initiative.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <br> \n <i>At Jacobs, By joining Jacobs, you’ll commit to supporting and engaging with these teams, as we work to build a company like no other.<\u002Fp> \n <p>We are looking for<b> Intermediate\u002FSenior Contract Administrators<\u002Fb> for a number of municipal waste water facilities for our Municipal Clients, based out of our Toronto, ON office.<\u002Fp> \n <p>As a <b>Contract Administrator<\u002Fb>, you will work as an Owner’s representative in the field, on various types of waste water facilities projects, leading other members of the site inspection and support team. You will coordinate and communicate with all stakeholders on a project, including: client project manager, municipalities, design team, pre-purchased equipment suppliers; and third parties: regulatory bodies, municipal and federal agencies; testing agencies and laboratories, as well as contractors.<\u002Fp> \n <p>You will ensure construction is in accordance with contract drawings and specifications; manage records of construction activities; prepare reports; keep logs; prepare change orders and payment certificates, keep photo records, etc. You will coordinate and facilitate with engineering design team review of shop drawing; requests for information; site instructions and assist in resolving design\u002Fconstruction issues in the field. You will evaluate, select, and apply company’s and client’s standards for construction inspections and administration.<\u002Fp> \n <p>If you’re up for the challenge, we’ve been looking for someone just like you. <p><i>Our People &amp; Places Solutions business – reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomizes the \"why\" of what we do – the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole. From facilities delivering life-saving therapies and ensuring clean water to enabling the connection of people through all modes of transportation and providing access to technology – we're integrating a multitude of these solution elements to build the smart environments of tomorrow.<\u002Fi><br> <br> <i>Start your Jacobs career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <br> \n <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> When it comes to environmental consulting, we’re helping our clients protect our world’s natural resources. As a <b>Field Aquatic Biologist<\u002Fb>, you will provide technical direction and support on the aquatic biology and water resource permitting components of our challenging natural resource projects, as well as coordination and guidance to our team of field biologists.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Based throughout western Canada, this position will start as a 6 to 9-month contract position (with the possibility of extension), this position will be primarily field based with some office work. You’ll have the chance to work as part of multi-disciplinary project teams to contribute directly to the environmental planning and permitting and efforts of government and privately-owned infrastructure projects throughout Canada. You will provide technical support for the duration of the life of the projects. You will have the opportunity to support the execution of the work including data collection efforts, as well as assist with the development of methodology, technical reports, and regulatory applications. This is a science-based role, and the successful candidate will have a known reputation in the industry as a technical expert and has shown ability to defend the technical rigor of the work completed. Bring your enthusiasm for learning and desire to conserve our natural resources, and we’ll help you grow!<\u002Fp> \n <p>At Jacobs, we’re partnering across the globe to create the best project outcomes by maximizing the design, digital technology, and support capabilities of our Global Integrated Delivery (GID) teammates. By joining Jacobs, you’ll commit to supporting and engaging with these teams, as we continuously work to build a company like no other.<\u002Fp> \n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <ul>\n  <li><br> B.Sc. or M.Sc degree in fish or aquatic-related studies with relevant experience conducting and managing aquatic studies (such as fish and fish habitat assessments, water quality monitoring, fish sampling, etc.).<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>Previous experience conducting aquatics field work, directing and\u002For managing aquatic crews in remote settings.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>Valid Electro-fishing certificate approved by Worksafe BC (https:\u002F\u002Fwww.worksafebc.com\u002Fen\u002Fhealth-safety\u002Feducation-training-certification\u002Felectrofishing-operator).<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>Relevant oil and gas and regulatory experience.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>Hold or be eligible for Professional Designation under the BC College of Applied Biology and\u002For the Alberta Society of Professional Biologists.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>Must have driver’s license and clean driver’s abstract.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p>Ideally, You’ll Also Have:<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Previous consulting experience with experience working with a diverse range of industrial clients.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>Working knowledge of the Federal Fisheries Act and other relevant provincial and federal environmental legislation in western Canada.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>Time management skills, with the ability to simultaneously work on multiple tasks\u002Fprojects and meet project deadlines.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>Experience in client liaison and business development.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>Detail oriented with excellent data capture and recording skills.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>Positive attitude, self-motivated with strong initiative.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <br> \n <i>At Jacobs, discovery and cutting-edge manufacturing, turning abstract ideas into realities that transform the world for good. At the same time, the risks posed by climate change and aging infrastructure requires an array of dynamic and innovative solutions to deliver resilient utility services. This energy transition is still in its early stages, and presents significant technical, logistical, and market challenges. Decarbonization will require detailed planning, multi-disciplinary collaboration, significant financial resources, and motivated staff to support successful implementation. Jacobs is expanding our Energy &amp; Power team to tackle the complexities of decarbonization to deliver a cleaner and more secure energy future.<\u002Fp> \n <p>By joining our team, as a T&amp;D Project Manager we’ll help you harness your expertise as an innovator and technologist to develop strategies to solve our client’s challenging energy needs. As a Project Manager for transmission, distribution, substation and distributed energy projects, you’ll work closely across operations, sales, and technology functions providing leadership as we expand our energy transitions portfolio. You can be based anywhere in North America.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Your industry expertise in the transmission and distribution industry will be focused on developing and managing programs for power transmission and distribution projects. Responsibilities will include analyzing market opportunities, developing scope and fee estimates for proposals and leading production teams to develop construction document packages including required specifications and drawings that will be utilized for bidding and construction. Additional responsibilities will include project controls, scheduling and program financial management for large utility scale distribution study, engineering, and field planning projects.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Other responsibilities will include collaboration with global resources to develop an industry-leading transmission and distribution engineering design practice within the firm.<\u002Fp> \n <p>If you are excited by the possibilities of a carbon-free energy future, motivated by a challenge, and enjoy working with a dynamic, multi-disciplinary team to develop innovative solutions, Jacobs is the place for you. our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole. We apply our expertise and knowledge as we investigate the future with great optimism and focus. We don’t settle until we give our best and know that we’re making a difference.<br> Jacobs seeks a Graphic Designer to join our Creative Solutions team to support Strategic Sales Operations. This position offers a flexible combination of remote and in-office options based on our current environment, client needs, candidate location and ability to work independently successfully. <\u002Fp>\n <p>The Graphic Designer will be a proactive team player, excited and ready to engage on a multitude of projects with various teams on a national level, focusing on the design and development of proposals and supporting graphics, presentations, and positioning materials – from concept to completion. Must have proven skills with Adobe CS software (primarily InDesign, Illustrator and Photoshop) and strong presentation development experience (primarily PowerPoint). Prior Architectural\u002FEngineering &amp; Construction and\u002For Proposal and Sales experience a plus.<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p>Applicants must provide either a portfolio link or PDF samples of work that highlight your work in layout, graphics, infographics, and presentations. <\u002Fp>\n <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Here's What You’ll Be Doing:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <ul>\n  <li>Leads strategic graphic design solutions to support in the production of winning proposals, sales materials, and presentations, including but not limited to long document layouts, PowerPoint presentations, story boards, covers\u002Fdividers, marketing collateral\u002Fbrochures, illustrations, interactive PDFs, ads, and digital media<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Plans, conceptualizes, and designs compelling and impactful graphics while collaborating with proposal team members and technical staff to strengthen messaging<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Conveys complex ideas with smart graphic designs and can develop concepts visually beyond bullet points <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Acts as a resource for graphic design methods and tools, developing and implementing process improvements, tool(s) improvements, and best practices<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Shares technical expertise with others and provides guidance and support; mentors other team members in technical areas<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <ul> \n  <li>Associates or bachelor’s degree in Graphic Design or related discipline from a four-year College\u002FUniversity; work experience in A\u002FE\u002FC that matches the requirements of the position in lieu of degree<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Professional graphic design experience; A\u002FE\u002FC and\u002For Sales experience a plus<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Strong skills in Adobe Creative Suite (InDesign, Illustrator, Photoshop, and Acrobat) and Microsoft PowerPoint; proficient with Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Outlook, Teams); experience working with additional creative, visual, interactive, and multimedia tools a plus<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Expert knowledge of procedures and technical concepts required for role<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Ideally, You’ll Also Have:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <ul>\n  <li>Collaborative and engaging work style – works well in a detail-focused, highly deadline-driven, team-oriented environment<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Proactive mindset – not shy about sharing ideas and working with different teams to bring concepts to life <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Ability to problem solve and contribute to moderate to complex visual solutions<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to recognize areas in proposals where graphics are best suited to tell the story<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <ul>\n  <li>Ability to handle multiple project assignments at a time, set priorities, manage your time, and organize work according to best practices<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Flexibility to work extended hours and weekends when project deadlines require<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to travel as needed to support sales efforts in other offices<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p>At Jacobs, we’re partnering across the globe to create the best project outcomes by maximizing the design, digital technology, and support capabilities of our Global Integrated Delivery (GID) teammates. By joining Jacobs, you’ll commit to supporting and engaging with these teams, as we work to build a company like no other.<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <br> \n <i>At Jacobs, we’re challenging today to reinvent tomorrow by solving the world’s most critical problems for thriving cities, resilient environments, mission-critical outcomes, operational advancement, scientific discovery and cutting-edge manufacturing, turning abstract ideas into realities that transform the world for good. <p><i>Our People &amp; Places Solutions business – reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomizes the \"why\" of what we do – the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole. From facilities delivering life-saving therapies and ensuring clean water to enabling the connection of people through all modes of transportation and providing access to technology – we're integrating a multitude of these solution elements to build the smart environments of tomorrow.<\u002Fi><br> <br> <i>Start your Jacobs career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <br> \n <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><b><br> Digital Delivery Lead<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>Support our Digital Delivery\u002FBIM team and have a hand in transforming tomorrow! Successful candidates will be focused on process plant and water\u002Fwastewater project delivery for clients across Canada. Successful candidates will be responsible for assisting in the delivery of projects, working with design and production teams located in multiple offices across our region. The successful candidate will thrive in a team environment, interact with teams in multiple offices, assist project\u002Fdesign managers, manage BIM applications as well as being responsible for drawing production and BIM deliverables.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>Responsibilities:<\u002Fb> <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Digital Delivery<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Working in the Digital Delivery Group, under direction of the Regional Technology Lead, the successful candidate will help manage design teams of technical staff, through BIM collaboration and project delivery.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Be responsible for project BIM organization, drawing production, and BIM-CADD standard enforcement on a variety of assignments. Specifically with a focus on process plant layout and piping systems. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Work closely with Project\u002FDesign managers and Design Engineers to help review layout and deliver quality project deliverables. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Provide Projectwise and BIM360 Common Data Environment (CDE) configuration and management.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Provide oversight and mentoring regarding BIM software, modeling technique, digital workflows and procedures.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Documenting project BIM-CAD delivery within the Engineering Technical Execution Plan.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Support project teams through design and construction phases, and assist with digital delivery scope, schedule, and budget.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Other duties as required.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>Model Management<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Organize and manage project BIM-CAD files in the associated CDE.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Define workflows and develop work instructions for project team direction.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Develop project specific BIM-CAD template files and discipline BIM content and configurations.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Assist discipline BIM leads with software configuration, content creation and data management.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Implement Client standards and project workflows to accommodate Client specific BIM-CAD and Data deliverables.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Develop and manage the federated project model for design, clash and quality review.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Host design coordination sessions with design management and discipline leads. Perform interference checking and model quality control. Review process equipment and piping arrangements, and comment on issues regarding design and O&amp;M requirements.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Develop models in Autodesk REVIT or Bentley BIM solutions covering multidiscipline aspects and BIM elements required for 4D, 5D, or 6D scopes of work.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Other duties as required.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>Drawing Management<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Prepare drawing packages for QA-QC reviews and Client submissions.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Develop cross discipline general drawings, general legends, submission index and cover sheets.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Develop project specific drawing borders for associated software.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Manage Title block and Revision data integrations with in the CDE.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Document control for all design stage deliverables and archives.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Provide drawing\u002Fmodeling progress updates and quality audits.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Develop drawings and sketches from BIM covering multidiscipline aspects and arrangements required for 4D, 5D, or 6D scopes of work.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Other duties as required.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>Digital Solutions<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Work with the Digital Delivery team to implement and expand on our suite of project lifecycle digital solutions.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Utilize virtual and augmented reality solutions for design and client review.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Manage the collection, formatting, and project distribution of Point Cloud data.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Coordinate model properties for 4D schedule integration and construction sequencing.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Coordinate model properties for 5D quantity take off and cost estimating.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Planning and development of BIM integrated asset data and documentation collection.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Develop project specific review and approval automations within the CDE.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Planning and management of record models for project lifecycle and client information handover.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Other duties as required.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <ul> \n  <li>Experience with process plant layout, equipment and piping arrangement best practices.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to establish close working relationship with project delivery teams, illustrating knowledge of BIM processes as they pertain to collaboration, coordination, and digital delivery.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>High level of organizational skills with a good attitude, strong leadership skills and excellent time management skills. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Able to work in a deadline driven, fast-paced environment.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Willingness to learn new software, products, concepts, techniques and help develop new practices and standards.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <ul>\n  <li>Strong technical skills related to BIM and CADD standards, and automation.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <ul>\n  <li>Ability to prepare electronic drawing files within project standards, using 3D modeling, sketches, layouts, project instructions and notes.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Possess a strong working knowledge of CAD drafting and BIM practices (NCS, AIA, CSI, NIBS, ISO19650)<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Expert knowledge in Autodesk REVIT, discipline specific configurations, templates, and family content creation is required.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Working knowledge with Bentley OpenBuildings, OpenPlant and OpenRoads Designer.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Expert knowledge of AutoCAD and Microstation is required.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience managing a project Common Data Environment; Bentley Projectwise and Autodesk BIM360<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience working with multi-discipline teams in multiple geographic offices<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <ul>\n  <li>Advanced knowledge of Autodesk Navisworks is required, exposure to Bentley iTwin would be an asset<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience with Bluebeam and Bluebeam Studio is required<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <ul>\n  <li>Experience with CADD and BIM software administration and configuration is required<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <ul>\n  <li>Able to set priorities and manage change to meet business needs and project schedules, while managing multiple BIM projects concurrently.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <ul>\n  <li>Excellent verbal, communication, and problem-solving skills, with strong attention to detail is a must.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <ul>\n  <li>Advanced knowledge of Windows O\u002FS and Microsoft Office is required.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>The minimum qualifications for this position are:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Post-secondary education in Architectural\u002FStructural\u002FMechanical\u002FCivil\u002FConstruction Technology, or an equivalent combination of education and experience.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Being and active member of OACETT \u002FCAN-BIM or eligible to become a member is an asset.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>5-10 years’ experience in delivering facility and process plant designs within a BIM digital environment.<\u002Fli> \n
