<p><i>Our People &amp; Places Solutions business – reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomizes the \"why\" of what we do – the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole. From facilities delivering life-saving therapies and ensuring clean water to enabling the connection of people through all modes of transportation and providing access to technology – we're integrating a multitude of these solution elements to build the smart environments of tomorrow.<\u002Fi><br> <br> <i>Start your Jacobs career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <br> \n <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> At Jacobs, we’re partnering across the globe to create the best project outcomes by maximizing the design, digital technology, and support capabilities of our Global Integrated Delivery (GID) teammates. By joining Jacobs, you’ll commit to supporting and engaging with these teams, as we work to build a company like no other.<br> <\u002Fp>\n <p>We challenge what is accepted, so we can shape innovative and lasting solutions for tomorrow. If you’re interested in a long and rewarding career working with the #1 ranked most admired engineering \u002F construction company in the world, then Jacobs is where you belong. We are looking for a driven and curious Intermediate Planner \u002F Scheduler in Vancouver, to support a large ongoing EPCM project.<br> <br> As a key member of our project controls team, you’ll be interacting with engineering, other consultants and construction contractors to update the project schedule. You will also analyze the schedule and recommend work-arounds and schedule improvements.<br> <br> Join us and we will assist you in continuing the development of your skills and exploring all that you can do across our global company, with opportunities to share your knowledge along the way.<\u002Fp> \n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <ul> \n  <li>Bachelor’s degree in construction management, engineering, project management, project accounting or related technical field preferred however experience in lieu of degree is acceptable.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>At least 5 years of Planning \u002F Scheduling experience<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Demonstrating effective leadership in the execution of scheduling activities on projects.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to effectively communicate complex schedule information to varied audiences including engineering, project\u002Fconstruction management, and project teams.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to write accurate and meaningful project status reports. Advanced Excel skills.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>A good understanding of design and construction scheduling timelines, and practices<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Assist in the development and maintenance of the whole lifecycle project schedules which reflect the strategy of the Project Delivery Team with clearly defined critical paths, interfaces and external dependencies<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Understand construction methodology, track access requirements and constraints, interfaces and third-party obligations.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Implement best practice schedule and integration techniques<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Strong experience with Primavera P6 (Version 8 or higher), spreadsheets\u002Fpivot tables and preferably Visio.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>Ideally, here’s what you’ll also have:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Strong analytical thinking and skills.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Solid knowledge and experience with earned value analysis<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Prefer EPCM, construction and port experience but will consider strong candidates from other sectors<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Prefer demonstrated experience and knowledge of very large, complex, multi-disciplinary construction projects<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Strong communication skills and understanding of technical terminology<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p>#LI-Hybrid<\u002Fp> \n <p>#bia<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <br> \n <i>At Jacobs, we’re challenging today to reinvent tomorrow by solving the world’s most critical problems for thriving cities, resilient environments, mission-critical outcomes, operational advancement, scientific discovery and cutting-edge manufacturing, turning abstract ideas into realities that transform the world for good. <p><i>Our People &amp; Places Solutions business – reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomizes the \"why\" of what we do – the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole. From facilities delivering life-saving therapies and ensuring clean water to enabling the connection of people through all modes of transportation and providing access to technology – we're integrating a multitude of these solution elements to build the smart environments of tomorrow.<\u002Fi><br> <br> <i>Start your Jacobs career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <br> \n <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> At Jacobs, we are a global leader in transportation consulting services. We strive to develop and provide unsurpassed Transit and Rail solutions to our clients in both the public and private sectors.<\u002Fp> \n <p>We are looking for a Submittals Coordinator – Transit \u002F Rail who will work under the direction of the Submittals Lead, the position is responsible for the coordination of project submittals. The incumbent will preferably have experience with capital projects engineering deliverables management, contract administration systems (e.g. CM14) with a minimum of 2 years of progressive experience ideally within major transit infrastructure projects is an asset. You’ll use independent judgment and excellent organizational skills, while you coordinate submittals (engineering and construction deliverables) in accordance with all company standards and contractual requirements.<\u002Fp> \n <p>This position performs in a fast-paced high energy team environment, supporting and assisting the Project Team through all project delivery phases for a large regional commuter transit project. The main phases of the project include Preliminary Design, Detail Design, Procurement and Construction contract administration.<\u002Fp> \n <p>If you're up for the challenge, we've been looking for someone just like you. Join our team and help us deliver successful projects.<\u002Fp> \n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <ul>\n  <li><br> Coordinate with Project’s Document Control team and other project stakeholders to:<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> o Receive submittals from project stakeholders including Project Company (Project Co)\n <br> o Receive, send, and maintain review comment registers between Project Co, Client, and stakeholders\n <br> o Review suitability of Client and Stakeholder comments in terms of formatting and compliance with requirements of the Project Agreement (Contract)\n <br> \n <ul>\n  <li>Tracking submittals to completion in accordance with the timescale requirements stated within the Project Agreement<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Monitoring Project’s schedule for submittals<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Building excellent relationship with Project Team and other project stakeholders<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Analyze and mitigate risk of delayed submittals and the impact on the project schedule<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Maintain documentation of activities<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Provide input to summary reports to Executive Management<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Highly responsive and ability to act quickly under changing circumstances<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Highly organized and ability to process and efficiently coordinate numerous submittals<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Effectively and positively influence Client and Stakeholder team members to comply with the Submittal process as set out in the Project Agreement<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Excellent written and presentation communication skills are required<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Positive influencing skills are an asset<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Accountable to the Submittals Lead<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p>You’ll also need:<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>BS or MS graduate of an engineering discipline or similar applicable technical discipline.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Preferably 2 to 5 years’ experience working within transit industry<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Knowledge of Project delivery using AFP, P3, or design\u002Fbuild methodology Capabilities is an asset<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Experience working in capital projects environment or as part of a Project Management Team is an asset<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Familiarity with engineering design management and review is an asset<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Knowledge of transit infrastructure construction an asset<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Understanding and practical application of contract administration and document management software, CM14 and Aconex are desired<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Understanding of project management principles is an asset<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Proficient with Microsoft Suite with a strong emphasis on Excel, and PowerPoint. Other CAD related software’s such as Bentley, Autodesk (MicroStation, AutoCAD, Revit) are considered an asset. Visualization software such as Sketch-Up also considered an asset.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <br> \n <i>At Jacobs, we’re challenging today to reinvent tomorrow by solving the world’s most critical problems for thriving cities, resilient environments, mission-critical outcomes, operational advancement, scientific discovery and cutting-edge manufacturing, turning abstract ideas into realities that transform the world for good. <p><i>Our People &amp; Places Solutions business – reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomizes the \"why\" of what we do – the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole. From facilities delivering life-saving therapies and ensuring clean water to enabling the connection of people through all modes of transportation and providing access to technology – we're integrating a multitude of these solution elements to build the smart environments of tomorrow.<\u002Fi><br> <br> <i>Start your Jacobs career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <br> \n <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> At Jacobs we don’t just design buildings; we design state-of-the-art facilities that simplify our everyday lives and power our virtual world today and into the future. We push the limits of what’s possible to make the world smarter, more connected and more sustainable.<\u002Fp> \n <p>We are looking for an <b>Intermediate Structural Engineer<\u002Fb> to join our <b>Toronto<\u002Fb> team. In this role you’ll participate in the development of technical specifications, plans, elevations, sections and details for various structural projects, including water \u002Fwastewater treatment, pumping stations, transportation, institutional, commercial and industrial facilities.<\u002Fp> \n <p><i>You’ll be working mainly from home (unless you prefer coming into the office), with the expectation to travel for client \u002Fsite meetings and occasional team meetings.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp> \n <p>In this role, you'll support a Lead Engineer on large, complex projects with engineering design, reporting, analysis and calculations. You’ll have the opportunity to lead smaller scopes of design work independently. You’ll coordinate with architects and other engineers in progression of design, as well as provide direction and markups to BIM\u002FCAD designers to develop the BIM and drawing sets. You’ll participate in client or contractor meetings and will support Contract Administration during construction through shop drawing reviews, responses to RFIs and site visits.<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <ul>\n  <li><br> Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Structural Engineering<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Professional Engineer registered in the Province of Ontario<\u002Fli>\n  <li>3-8 years of applicable experience in working as a licensed structural engineer in design of commercial or industrial buildings<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Strong communication and technical writing skills<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Experience with structural analysis software (i.e., STAAD, RAM, SAP2000, Visual Analysis, etc)<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Experience with all aspects of building engineering design, including phases spanning from preliminary design through to construction<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p>#LI-Hybrid<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <br> \n <i>At Jacobs, we’re challenging today to reinvent tomorrow by solving the world’s most critical problems for thriving cities, resilient environments, mission-critical outcomes, operational advancement, scientific discovery and cutting-edge manufacturing, turning abstract ideas into realities that transform the world for good. With $13 billion in revenue and a talent force of more than 55,000, Jacobs provides a full spectrum of professional services including consulting, technical, scientific and project delivery for the <p><i>Our People &amp; Places Solutions business – reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomizes the \"why\" of what we do – the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole. From facilities delivering life-saving therapies and ensuring clean water to enabling the connection of people through all modes of transportation and providing access to technology – we're integrating a multitude of these solution elements to build the smart environments of tomorrow.<\u002Fi><br> <br> <i>Start your Jacobs career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <br> \n <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> At Jacobs, we're partnering across the globe to create the best project outcomes by maximizing the design, digital technology, and support capabilities of our Global Integrated Delivery (GID) teammates. By joining Jacobs, you'll commit to supporting and engaging with these teams as we work to build a company like no other. <\u002Fp>\n <p>Whether it's for treating water, hosting businesses, or connecting our world, solutions are continuously being implemented. What we do is more than construction; we play a part in moving a vision from concept to reality. We work every day to create the spaces people live in and the infrastructure to improve their lives. If you want to join a company where you can have a tangible impact, join us as an <b>Intermediate Tunneling Contract Administrator<\u002Fb> in our <b>Toronto, ON<\u002Fb> office. <\u002Fp>\n <p>You will have the chance to work on exciting and engaging water and wastewater infrastructure and conveyance projects for our Municipal Clients, where you will utilize your expertise to collaborate with our teams in a safe and efficient delivery – from start to finish. <\u002Fp>\n <p>As an <b>Intermediate Tunneling Contract Administrator<\u002Fb>, you will work as an Owner's representative in the field, on various types of infrastructure and conveyance projects, leading other members of the site inspection and support team. You will coordinate and communicate with all stakeholders on a project, including: client project manager, municipalities, design team, and third parties: regulatory bodies, municipal and federal agencies; testing agencies and laboratories, as well as contractors. <\u002Fp>\n <p>You will ensure construction is in accordance with contract drawings and specifications; manage records of construction activities; prepare reports; keep logs; prepare change orders and payment certificates, keep photo records, etc. You will coordinate and facilitate with engineering design team review of shop drawing; requests for information, site instructions and assist in resolving design\u002Fconstruction issues in the field. You will evaluate, select, and apply company's and client's standards for construction inspections and administration. <\u002Fp>\n <p>If you're up for the challenge, we've been looking for someone just like you. Join our team and help us deliver successful projects.<\u002Fp> \n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <ul> \n  <li>A current licence in good standing with a public body within the province of Ontario, such as Professional Engineers of Ontario (P.Eng.) (preferred) or The Ontario Association of Certified Engineering Technicians and Technologists - Certified Engineering Technologist (C.E.T.)<\u002Fli> \n  <li>University degree or Engineering technology diploma or demonstrated experience <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Minimum of 12 years of linear conveyance construction administration experience is required.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Minimum of 6 years prior experience on tunneling projects is preferred. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Municipal client project experience is required<\u002Fli> \n  <li>High capital value project or program experience preferred<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to effectively communicate with clients and contractors <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Ability to tolerate outdoor weather conditions in summer and winter. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Experience working in the GTA is strongly preferred <\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>Ideally you'll also have:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Engineering and heavy construction experience in municipal infrastructure and conveyance projects<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Proven track record of delivering heavy construction projects on time and within budget<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Demonstrated ability to direct and\u002For supervise project teams <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Foresight and balanced judgement in anticipating and solving problems during construction. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Worked as owner's representative in managing construction contracts including; acting as the primary point of contract, preparing payments, change orders, request for information, schedule review and oversight, time extensions, and certificates of completion. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Preparation and distribution of weekly reports<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Participate and run effective daily\u002Fweekly CM meetings<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Participate in Project Workshops, Client and Construction meetings<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Valid driver's license and a car to drive to the sites <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Ability to work at heights <\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <i>At Jacobs, we’re challenging today to reinvent tomorrow by solving the world’s most critical problems for thriving cities, resilient environments, mission-critical outcomes, operational advancement, scientific discovery and cutting-edge manufacturing, turning abstract ideas into realities that transform the world for good. <p><i>Our People &amp; Places Solutions business – reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomizes the \"why\" of what we do – the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole. From facilities delivering life-saving therapies and ensuring clean water to enabling the connection of people through all modes of transportation and providing access to technology – we're integrating a multitude of these solution elements to build the smart environments of tomorrow.<\u002Fi><br> <br> <i>Start your Jacobs career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <br> \n <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> When it comes to environmental consulting, we’re helping our clients protect our world’s natural resources. As a wildlife biologist, you will provide technical direction and support for the wildlife biology components of our challenging natural resource projects, as well as mentoring and guidance to our team of biologists. Pave the way for your career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow. You'll impact the world around you by helping us solve real-life challenges. <\u002Fp>\n <p>Based throughout Western Canada, this position may have the opportunity to be fulltime based on workload or will begin as a 6 – 9 month contract with opportunity for extension or transfer into full-time. You’ll have the opportunity to work as part of multi-disciplinary project teams associated with our Western Canada Offices and projects to contribute directly to the environmental planning, permitting, and construction support efforts of government and privately-owned infrastructure projects. As an <b>Intermediate Biologist <\u002Fb>with a focus on wildlife, the successful candidate will be responsible for leading field crews, including data collection efforts, assisting with the development of methodology, and some technical writing. This is a science-based role, and the successful candidate will have a known reputation in the industry as a technical expert and has shown integrity for the work completed. While wildlife studies will comprise the majority of work, the Intermediate Biologist could also be required to support other biophysical disciplines as needed. Bring your enthusiasm for learning and desire to conserve our natural resources, and we’ll help you grow!<\u002Fp> \n <p>At Jacobs, we’re partnering across the globe to create the best project outcomes by maximizing the design, digital technology, and support capabilities of our Global Integrated Delivery (GID) teammates. By joining Jacobs, you’ll commit to supporting and engaging with these teams, as we continuously work to build a company like no other.<\u002Fp> \n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <ul>\n  <li><br> B.Sc. or M.Sc. in biology or other environmental discipline, primarily related to wildlife, or equivalent demonstrated experience<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>Hold or be eligible for a Professional designation, with an organization such as the Alberta Society of Professional Biologists and\u002For the BC College of Applied Biology<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>Relevant professional experience in environmental consulting related to wildlife<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>Demonstrated knowledge of provincial and federal wildlife legislation and regulatory requirements, primarily in western Canada<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <p>Relevant experience conducting wildlife field surveys with a varied knowledge of Canadian wildlife<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Ability to lead wildlife-related field studies, review and QA field data, and direct and\u002For manage wildlife crews in remote settings, with an emphasis on wildlife feature searches, bird surveys and nest searches, amphibian surveys and relocations, and targeted species-at-risk surveys<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>Willingness to work in the field in remote locations for extended periods of time and overnight at hotels and project work camps <\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <ul>\n  <li>Excellent interpersonal skills, team-oriented, and suited to work as part of a multi-disciplinary team<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>Positive attitude, self-motivated with strong initiative, and desire to lead and mentor fellow biologists<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>A driver’s license and ability to provide a clean, 3 year driving abstract<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Ideally, You’ll Also Have<\u002Fb>:<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Previous consulting experience and experience working with adverse range of industrial clients<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>Demonstrated technical writing skills and experience writing applications and reports for activities that are provincially and\u002For federally regulated<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>Experience in support of other biophysical study areas such as wetlands, rare plants, weeds, and\u002For fisheries both during field assessments and with office tasks<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>Ability to think strategically in developing novel approaches to wildlife management and mitigation<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>Experience in client and stakeholder relationships<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <br> \n <i>At Jacobs, we’re <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> At Jacobs, we solve the most important problems. We create solutions for the real world – making life simpler and more seamless along the way. We’re united by the drive to dream big while keeping our feet firmly planted on the ground.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Our Client Deliverables Solutions (CDS) is a team of storytellers, helping our project teams convey the message of the work we do at Jacobs. CDS provides professional editing, writing, graphic design, and document publishing services to enhance our contracted client-facing documents. As a part of our CDS team, you’ll influence materials ranging from project communications for a highly technical audience to public-facing documents that present technical information in an approachable, understandable way. From multivolume regulatory submittals to straightforward memos and project reports, you’ll partner with project teams to develop and deliver quality, consistent, and cost-effective work products, demonstrating how Jacobs is challenging today and reinventing tomorrow.<\u002Fp> \n <p>As a Technical Writer\u002FEditor, you’ll help develop and deliver everything from short-term local projects to long-term, complex programs that encompass work around the globe. You’re comfortable interviewing and working with subject matter experts and crafting their stories into content they can then review and round out. From writing to revising for a unified voice, to editing for clarity and consistency, you’ve got the fundamental skills to make complex content readable and relatable for various audiences. You’re a self-starter, eager to demonstrate your creative communication solutions, tackling challenges, crushing deadlines, and far exceeding client expectations along the way. Your collaboration with graphic design, document publishing, and production staff will contribute to the success of your team and polish the brand of #OurJacobs.#LI-Remote<\u002Fp> \n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <ul> \n  <li>Bachelor's degree in English, Journalism, Communications, or related discipline from an accredited college or university<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience editing technical (non-IT) or industry-based documents in a professional environment<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience writing content (in collaboration with subject matter experts) for various uses, including award and grant applications, white papers, training modules, video scripts, fact sheets, and brochures<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience combining the contributions of multiple technical authors to create narratives with a unified “voice”<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience managing all aspects of a deliverable program (developing outlines and templates, managing files and version control, establishing and communicating program standards and styles, adhering to budget and schedule, and communicating with project teams and colleagues in various venues)<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Demonstrated time management skills, to include completing work on time, scaling your approach to suit the project schedule, collaborating with colleagues to balance workload, and relying on standard processes and tools to make your time as efficient as possible.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>A commitment to providing the best quality work you can in the time provided for the work, to include engaging in quality reviews and implementing feedback<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Flexibility to work occasional evenings and weekends when our success depends on you<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p>To be successful in this role, you should be familiar with:<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Microsoft Office (especially Word, PowerPoint, and Excel)<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Adobe publishing programs (specifically Acrobat; knowledge of InDesign, Illustrator, and Photoshop is a plus)<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Standard editing conventions, such as those in the current edition of The Chicago Manual of Style or the Associated Press Stylebook<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Grammatical rules, clear and concise writing, and references and citations<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Shared workspace platforms (SharePoint, ProjectWise, and Teams), visual mediums, and delivery options<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Section 508 Accessibility Compliance<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <br> \n <p><i>At Jacobs, we’re challenging today to reinvent tomorrow by solving the world’s most critical problems for thriving cities, resilient environments, mission-critical outcomes, operational advancement, scientific discovery and cutting-edge manufacturing, turning abstract ideas into realities that transform the world for good. With $13 billion in revenue and a talent force of more than 55,000, Jacobs provides a full spectrum of professional services including consulting, technical, scientific and project delivery for the government and private This individual needs to be highly personal and a quick learner. Your initial role will be to undertake field reviews, field inspections, and structural calculations on a variety of road and transit structures. Following an initial training period your role will progressively grow to include supporting our business development and project delivery teams. The incumbent should be willing to work in a team environment, interact with clients and approval agencies, and assist project\u002Flead engineers in their deliverables.<\u002Fp> \n <p><i>Our People &amp; Places Solutions business – reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomizes the \"why\" of what we do – the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole. From facilities delivering life-saving therapies and ensuring clean water to enabling the connection of people through all modes of transportation and providing access to technology – we're integrating a multitude of these solution elements to build the smart environments of tomorrow.<\u002Fi><br> <br> <i>Start your Jacobs career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <br> \n <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> At Jacobs, we’re partnering across the globe to create the best project outcomes by maximizing the design, digital technology, and support capabilities of our Global Integrated Delivery (GID) teammates. By joining Jacobs, you’ll commit to supporting and engaging with these teams, as we work to build a company like no other.<br> <\u002Fp>\n <p>As a <b>Process Mechanical Design Technician <\u002Fb>in our <b>Toronto<\u002Fb> office you will have the opportunity to apply your knowledge of 3D modelling while following project automation standards and support your design team to efficiently deliver project design work. You will be responsible for preparing drawings and sketches with various CAD-BIM software, using appropriate design criteria and technical manuals. You will work closely with engineers and other teams and disciplines to coordinate designs, ensuring that the completed, integrated product meets or exceeds client expectations. Working with other members of the team, you will resolve complex technical issues and help to define and maintain the technical standards around which others operate.<\u002Fp> \n <p>During your time with us, you will receive project assignments from local and remote Process Mechanical Project Team Leaders and work with discipline lead engineers to perform project related tasks. You will prepare construction package drawings for Water\u002F Wastewater treatment infrastructure Process Mechanical, HVAC, Plumbing, and Fire Protection systems for our client facilities and coordinate your work with other disciplines as needed. You will take responsibility for assigned portions of the design scope, budget, and schedule and support work in other offices as needed. If you're up for the challenge, we've been looking for someone just like you. <\u002Fp>\n <p><i>You’ll be working mainly from home (unless you prefer coming into the office), with the expectation to travel for client \u002Fsite meetings and occasional team meetings.<\u002Fi><br> <\u002Fp>\n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <ul> \n  <li>College or university education in a technical field or equivalent experience.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Minimum 3 years’ experience in the water\u002Fwastewater industry<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Proficient in Windows based software and MS Office 2010 or higher<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Proficient in drawing production using Bentley and Autodesk platforms<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience in 3D modelling for full plant Building Information Modeling design using Autodesk Revit<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience in 3D modelling for full plant Building Information Modeling design using Bentley OpenPlant Modeler and AECOsim would be an asset <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Possess a positive attitude, are dependable with the ability to work independently as well as part of a team to meet deadlines and provide a high quality of work<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Have good interpersonal communication skills <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Participate in achieving the Jacobs BeyondZero safety plan by joining in our strong culture to keeping everyone healthy and safe<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Ideally, you’ll also have:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Experience with intelligent P&amp;ID tools. (Bentley OpenPlant P&amp;ID, AutoCAD P&amp;ID) would be an asset<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Bentley Suite - (MicroStation, AecoSIM, OpenPlant Modeler and P&amp;ID)<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Bentley Navigator or Autodesk Navisworks an asset<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Autodesk Revit with focus on Mechanical and Process design<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Solidworks an asset<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p>#LI-Hybrid<\u002Fp> \n <p>#bia<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <br> \n <i>At Jacobs, we’re challenging today to reinvent tomorrow by solving the world’s most critical problems for thriving cities, resilient environments, mission-critical outcomes, operational advancement, scientific discovery and cutting-edge manufacturing, turning abstract ideas into realities that transform the world for good. <p><i>Our People &amp; Places Solutions business – reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomizes the \"why\" of what we do – the tremendous positive impact and value Your role will depend on strength of the inspection team and the needs of each project site.<\u002Fp> \n <p>As a Sr. Civil\u002FRoadway site Inspector, you’ll have the chance to work as an Owner’s representative in the field, providing construction services on major roadway expansion and civil infrastructure projects around the GTA. Working with other members of the team, you’ll coordinate and communicate with all parties on a project, including engineering design team, client project manager, and third parties such as regulatory bodies, testing agencies, contractors, laboratories, etc.<\u002Fp> \n <p>During your time with us, you will ensure construction is in accordance with contract drawings and specifications, keep adequate records of construction activities, prepare reports, logs, photo records, etc, as well as work with an engineering design team to coordinate correspondence such as shop drawing reviews, requests for information, site instructions, and assist in resolving design issues in the field. Under general supervision, you will evaluate, select, and apply standard construction inspections and administration techniques, procedures, and criteria. If you’re up for the challenge, we’ve been looking for someone just like you. <\u002Fp>\n <p>You have a good knowledge of construction practices and related regulatory and\u002For industry requirements and practices. You should be knowledgeable with roadway and heavy civil municipal infrastructure construction inspection. Experience related to bridge construction, and other linear infrastructure would be considered an asset. You demonstrate proactive decision making and insist upon high quality implementation of our design in the field.<\u002Fp> \n <p>You are Jacobs’ face to the client and public during construction, and as such you have demonstrated strengths in respectful communication, problem solving, and a love for working with people and getting things done. We’re seeking an emerging Environmental Project Manager to oversee projects for private energy clients. You’ll apply your technical experience in planning and permitting projects while championing safety, quality, and the well-being of your team.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Based out of one of our office locations or out of your home office in Alberta or British Columbia, you’ll have the opportunity to contribute to support government and privately-owned infrastructure projects in all life stages of the projects from the early development stages all the way to post-construction environmental monitoring and operations. Working with our strong technical team and senior Project Managers, you will be responsible for meeting internal and external client objectives and project-specific internal financial goals. You’ll provide motivation and direction to project teams, have opportunities for client interaction, and be surrounded by mentorship and mentoring opportunities to help you and your team thrive. Our global team is here to provide you with the tools to keep your career growing as well as those around you. By driving consistency and innovation across infrastructure development projects and keeping on schedule and budget, you’ll help your team achieve the clients’ goals.<\u002Fp> \n <p>At Jacobs, we’re partnering across the globe to create the best project outcomes by maximizing the design, digital technology, and support capabilities of our Global Integrated Delivery (GID) teammates. We don’t settle until we give our best and know that we’re making a difference.<br> Jacobs seeks a Graphic Designer to join our Creative Solutions team to support Strategic Sales Operations. This position offers a flexible combination of remote and in-office options based on our current environment, client needs, candidate location and ability to work independently successfully. <\u002Fp>\n <p>The Graphic Designer will be a proactive team player, excited and ready to engage on a multitude of projects with various teams on a national level, focusing on the design and development of proposals and supporting graphics, presentations, and positioning materials – from concept to completion. Must have proven skills with Adobe CS software (primarily InDesign, Illustrator and Photoshop) and strong presentation development experience (primarily PowerPoint). Prior Architectural\u002FEngineering &amp; Construction and\u002For Proposal and Sales experience a plus.<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p>Applicants must provide either a portfolio link or PDF samples of work that highlight your work in layout, graphics, infographics, and presentations. <\u002Fp>\n <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Here's What You’ll Be Doing:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <ul>\n  <li>Leads strategic graphic design solutions to support in the production of winning proposals, sales materials, and presentations, including but not limited to long document layouts, PowerPoint presentations, story boards, covers\u002Fdividers, marketing collateral\u002Fbrochures, illustrations, interactive PDFs, ads, and digital media<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Plans, conceptualizes, and designs compelling and impactful graphics while collaborating with proposal team members and technical staff to strengthen messaging<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Conveys complex ideas with smart graphic designs and can develop concepts visually beyond bullet points <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Acts as a resource for graphic design methods and tools, developing and implementing process improvements, tool(s) improvements, and best practices<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Shares technical expertise with others and provides guidance and support; mentors other team members in technical areas<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <ul> \n  <li>Associates or bachelor’s degree in Graphic Design or related discipline from a four-year College\u002FUniversity; work experience in A\u002FE\u002FC that matches the requirements of the position in lieu of degree<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Professional graphic design experience; A\u002FE\u002FC and\u002For Sales experience a plus<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Strong skills in Adobe Creative Suite (InDesign, Illustrator, Photoshop, and Acrobat) and Microsoft PowerPoint; We’re seeking an emerging Environmental Project Manager to oversee projects for private energy clients. <p><i>Our People &amp; Places Solutions business – reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomizes the \"why\" of what we do – the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole. From facilities delivering life-saving therapies and ensuring clean water to enabling the connection of people through all modes of transportation and providing access to technology – we're integrating a multitude of these solution elements to build the smart environments of tomorrow.<\u002Fi><br> <br> <i>Start your Jacobs career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <br> \n <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> We challenge what is accepted, so we can shape innovative and lasting solutions for tomorrow. If you’re interested in a long and rewarding career working with the #1 ranked most admired engineering and construction company in the world, then Jacobs is where you belong. We are looking for a driven and curious Senior Planner \u002F Scheduler in Toronto to support various Transit and Rail projects.<br> <br> As a leader on our program support team, you’ll perform more complex aspects of planning and scheduling activities; ensuring that all project control activities such as project planning, project administration, change management, project estimating, cost management and schedule management are executed. We’ll ask you to work with the project team to establish Work Breakdown Structures and Baseline Schedules, as well as prepare schedule risk analysis to forecast contingencies. As a senior member, we’ll ask you to conduct and co-ordinate reviews of Consultants, Contractors and Vendor schedules, to ensure plans are realistic and achievable.<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p>You’ll also be involved with Scheduling Quality Compliance on Schedules meeting PMI\u002FCompany Standards and developing and implementing an earned value system that accurately measure project work progress and performance. We’ll rely on you to carry out what-if and delay analysis’ and look to you for recommendations on scheduling procedures.<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p>Bring your curiosity, passion for innovation, and talent for multi-tasking in a fast-paced environment. We’ll help you grow, pursue and fulfill what inspires you – so we can make big impacts on the world, together.<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <ul>\n  <li><br> Must have current and relevant Transit \u002F Rail experience<\u002Fli>\n  <li>At least 10+ years of Planning \u002F Scheduling experience<\u002Fli>\n  <li>A good understanding of building construction, timelines, and practices<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Experience Working inside the Primavera (P6) scheduling tool; minimum 2 years’ experience<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Proficiency with Scheduling systems spreadsheets, word processing software, databases and report writers<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Bachelor’s Degree in construction management, Engineering, Project Management, or related technical field<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Transit Planning\u002FScheduling experience<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><br> Ideally, here’s what you’ll also have:<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Experience with EVM (Earned Value Management)<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Active membership in AACE, PMI, or similar association.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>PSP or PMI-SP certification a plus<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Ability to develop cost \u002F schedule analysis presentations both graphically, written, and verbally.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Strong communication skills and understanding of technical terminology<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <br> \n <i>At Jacobs, we’re challenging today to reinvent tomorrow by solving the world’s most critical problems for thriving cities, resilient environments, mission-critical outcomes, operational advancement, scientific discovery and cutting-edge manufacturing, turning abstract ideas into realities that transform the world for good. With $13 billion in revenue and a talent force of more than 55,000, Jacobs provides a full spectrum of professional services including consulting, technical, scientific and project delivery for the <p><i>Our People &amp; Places Solutions business – reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomizes the \"why\" of what we do – the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole. From facilities delivering life-saving therapies and ensuring clean water to enabling the connection of people through all modes of transportation and providing access to technology – we're integrating a multitude of these solution elements to build the smart environments of tomorrow.<\u002Fi><br> <br> <i>Start your Jacobs career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <br> \n <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> When it comes to environmental consulting, we’re helping our clients protect our world’s natural resources. As a wildlife biologist, you will provide technical direction and support for the wildlife biology components of our challenging natural resource projects, as well as mentoring and guidance to our team of biologists. Pave the way for your career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow. You'll impact the world around you by helping us solve real-life challenges. <\u002Fp>\n <p>Based throughout Western Canada, this position may have the opportunity to be fulltime based on workload or will begin as a 6 – 9 month contract with opportunity for extension or transfer into full-time. You’ll have the opportunity to work as part of multi-disciplinary project teams associated with our Western Canada Offices and projects to contribute directly to the environmental planning, permitting, and construction support efforts of government and privately-owned infrastructure projects. As an <b>Intermediate Biologist <\u002Fb>with a focus on wildlife, the successful candidate will be responsible for leading field crews, including data collection efforts, assisting with the development of methodology, and some technical writing. This is a science-based role, and the successful candidate will have a known reputation in the industry as a technical expert and has shown integrity for the work completed. While wildlife studies will comprise the majority of work, the Intermediate Biologist could also be required to support other biophysical disciplines as needed. Bring your enthusiasm for learning and desire to conserve our natural resources, and we’ll help you grow!<\u002Fp> \n <p>At Jacobs, we’re partnering across the globe to create the best project outcomes by maximizing the design, digital technology, and support capabilities of our Global Integrated Delivery (GID) teammates. By joining Jacobs, you’ll commit to supporting and engaging with these teams, as we continuously work to build a company like no other.<\u002Fp> \n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <ul>\n a Professional designation, with an organization such as the Alberta Society of Professional Biologists and\u002For the BC College of Applied Biology<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>Relevant professional experience in environmental consulting related to wildlife<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>Demonstrated knowledge of provincial and federal wildlife legislation and regulatory requirements, primarily in western Canada<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <p>Relevant experience conducting wildlife field surveys with a varied knowledge of Canadian wildlife<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Ability to lead wildlife-related field studies, review and QA field data, and direct and\u002For manage wildlife crews in remote settings, with an emphasis on wildlife feature searches, bird surveys and nest searches, amphibian surveys and relocations, and targeted species-at-risk surveys<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>Willingness to work in the field in remote locations for extended periods of time and overnight at hotels and project work camps <\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <ul>\n  <li>Excellent interpersonal skills, team-oriented, and suited to work as part of a <p><i>Our People &amp; Places Solutions business – reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomizes the \"why\" of what we do – the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole. From facilities delivering life-saving therapies and ensuring clean water to enabling the connection of people through all modes of transportation and providing access to technology – we're integrating a multitude of these solution elements to build the smart environments of tomorrow.<\u002Fi><br> <br> <i>Start your Jacobs career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <br> \n <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> At Jacobs, we’re partnering across the globe to create the best project outcomes by maximizing the design, digital technology, and support capabilities of our Global Integrated Delivery (GID) teammates. By joining Jacobs, you’ll commit to supporting and engaging with these teams, as we work to build a company like no other.<\u002Fp> \n <p>When it comes to environmental consulting, we’re helping our clients secure our world’s natural resources. As a Senior Aquatic Biologist, you will provide technical leadership and guidance on the aquatic biology and water resource permitting components of our challenging natural resource projects, as well as coordination and support to our team of biologists.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Based throughout western Canada, this will be a full-time, mostly office-based role. You’ll have the opportunity to work as part of multi-disciplinary project teams guiding aquatic environmental planning and permitting efforts for government and privately-owned infrastructure projects. You will provide technical direction for the duration of these projects, throughout the design, construction, and operations phases. On projects, you will have the opportunity to lead the implementation of the work including the development of methodology, review of data collection efforts, technical reports, and regulatory applications and liaison. In this position you will establish and maintain relationships with clients, regulators and sub-contractors. This is a science-based role, and the successful candidate will have a reputation in the industry as a technical expert, and a demonstrated ability to defend the technical rigor of the work completed. Bring your expertise in environmental science and desire to conserve our natural resources, and we’ll empower you to deliver the boldest solutions for our clients.<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <ul>\n  <li><br> B.Sc. or M.Sc degree in fish or aquatic-related studies with relevant experience conducting and managing aquatic studies (such as fish and fish habitat assessments, water quality monitoring, fish sampling, etc.).<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>A minimum 12 years of experience (preferred 15+ years’ experience) as a Fish\u002FAquatic Biologist in the natural resources sector in western Canada, preferably in a consulting environment.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>Previous experience overseeing aquatics field work, directing and\u002For managing aquatic crews in remote settings from the office.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>Excellent technical writing skills and experience providing technical review and edits as needed.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>Relevant oil and gas and regulatory experience.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>Hold or be eligible for Professional Designation under the BC College of Applied Biology and the Alberta Society of Professional Biologists.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>Previous consulting experience.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>In depth knowledge and experience with the Federal Fisheries Act and other relevant provincial and federal environmental legislation in western Canada and how it applies to natural resource projects.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>Experience liaising with regulators and providing strategic regulatory advice to clients and internal teams during all stages of the project life cycle.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>Experience in client liaison and business development.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>Must have driver’s license and clean driver’s abstract.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <p>Ideally, You’ll Also Have:<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Experience working with a diverse range of industrial clients, including oil and gas, mining, transportation, and energy.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>Time management skills, with the ability to simultaneously work on multiple tasks\u002Fprojects and meet project deadlines.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>Detail oriented with excellent organization skills.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>Positive attitude, self-motivated with strong initiative<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <br> \n <p><i>Our People &amp; Places Solutions business – reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomizes the \"why\" of what we do – the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole. From facilities delivering life-saving therapies and ensuring clean water to enabling the connection of people through all modes of transportation and providing access to technology – we're integrating a multitude of these solution elements to build the smart environments of tomorrow.<\u002Fi><br> <br> <i>Start your Jacobs career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <br> \n <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> At Jacobs, we’re partnering across the globe to create the best project outcomes by maximizing the design, digital technology, and support capabilities of our Global Integrated Delivery (GID) teammates. By joining, Jacobs, you’ll commit to supporting and engaging with these teams, as we work to build a company like no other.<\u002Fp> \n <p>When it comes to environmental consulting, we’re focused on cleaning up our communities today to improve tomorrow. We’re seeking an experienced Engineer-in-Training or Professional Engineer to support or lead brownfield re-development, decommissioning and demolition projects, implementing characterization and remediation solution services for industrial and government clients. You’ll apply your technical experience in remedial design and construction management to plan and support the strategic execution of project tasks while championing safety, quality, and the well-being of your team.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Based in Ontario and reporting to either Kitchener or Toronto offices, you’ll have the opportunity to work on remediation, decommissioning or demolition projects across Ontario, with the flexibility to work independently at home or in teams at the office. You’ll work in a team and support the planning and execution of design work, including engineered drawings, specifications and other construction tender document. Working with Senior and Junior engineers and scientists, you will support the overall execution of the technical scope. You’ll be supported by a diverse group of industry leading technical expert available through our multiple communities of practice. You’ll drive innovation and promote the use of digital tools and electronic data capture. You’ll build strong relationships with our clients and work with client account managers to position and win new work. You’ll demonstration continuous alignment to Jacobs core values to achieve our clients’ goals.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Bring your commitment to safety and innovation, motivation to work well independently, as well as your ability to collaborate with a diverse group, and we’ll help grow what drives you.<\u002Fp> \n <p>#ges23<\u002Fp> \n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <ul> \n  <li>Engineer-in-Training (EIT) designation or licensed engineering in Ontario having supported conceptual to detailed design and the preparation of construction procurement packages.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Provide creative solutions to complex environmental problems by combining regulatory risk assessment with remedial technologies.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Leverage teams comprising of different technical disciplines to complete task and prepare technical deliverables for clients, regulatory agencies, or other stakeholders.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>In-depth knowledge of Ontario’s environmental regulation and guidelines.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience overseeing construction including understanding of contract administration practices.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to demonstrate a strong record in health and safety, including experience with behavior-based health &amp; safety programs.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Must hold valid Ontario driver’s license.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Curiosity to find better solutions, embrace digital solutions and drive innovation towards a more sustainable world.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>Ideally, You’ll Also Have:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Business development acumen that seeks to uncover our client’s problems and find industry-leading, innovative solutions to solve them.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Strong understanding of financial metrics and how to evaluate them as part of successful project management.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Strong, persuasive technical writing skills to support proposal writing.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <i>At Jacobs, we’re challenging today to reinvent tomorrow by solving the world’s most critical problems for thriving cities, resilient environments, mission-critical outcomes, operational advancement, scientific discovery and cutting-edge manufacturing, turning abstract ideas into realities that transform the world for good. With $13 billion in revenue and a talent force of more than 55,000, Jacobs provides a full spectrum of professional services including consulting, technical, scientific and project delivery for the government and private <p><i>Our People &amp; Places Solutions business – reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomizes the \"why\" of what we do – the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole. From facilities delivering life-saving therapies and ensuring clean water to enabling the connection of people through all modes of transportation and providing access to technology – we're integrating a multitude of these solution elements to build the smart environments of tomorrow.<\u002Fi><br> <br> <i>Start your Jacobs career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <br> \n <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> At Jacobs, we’re partnering across the globe to create the best project outcomes by maximizing the design, digital technology, and support capabilities of our Global Integrated Delivery (GID) teammates. By joining Jacobs, you’ll commit to supporting and engaging with these teams, as we work to build a company like no other.<br> <\u002Fp>\n <p>When it comes to environmental consulting, we’re helping our clients protect our world’s natural resources. As the <b>Lead Ecologist,<\u002Fb> you will provide our team in <b>Toronto<\u002Fb> with support and expertise in field biology, regulatory strategy, analysis, and permitting. You’ll join a group of other biologists, ecologists, environmental scientists and planners to work on a variety of natural heritage projects including; Environmental Assessments (EA), Environmental Impact Studies (EIS), Natural Heritage Evaluations (NHE), Species at Risk (SAR) surveys, arborist surveys and fisheries assessment <\u002Fp>\n <p>You'll primarily work with engineers and Project Managers from cross business group projects including linear water conveyance, transportation, water\u002Fwastewater treatment, mining and contaminated sites, on screening projects with the agencies (i.e. MECP, MNRF, DFO and Conservation Authorities), terrestrial and aquatic field surveys, data management and technical reporting. The position will mainly consist of office duties, with an option of assisting with field duties, if required. <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>General Duties and Responsibilities include:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Leading and mentoring a small team of multi-disciplinary (terrestrial, aquatics, wildlife, species at risk) field ecologists and arborists.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Provide expertise with natural environment permitting, navigating the agencies and managing client expectations regarding environmental risk<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Lead and organize Natural Environment tasks which will include: \n   <ul>\n    <li>Wetland delineation, Targeted SAR surveys, Ecological Land Classification (ELC), mammal and herptile surveys;<\u002Fli> \n    <li>Fisheries assessment, including physical surveys, spawning surveys, habitat characterization and fish capture (i.e., electrofishing);<\u002Fli> \n    <li>Submitting and securing permitting approvals (i.e., Conservation Authority regulations, Endangered Species Act and, Species at Risk Act and various self-assessment, screening and Fisheries Act Authorities under DFO);<\u002Fli> \n    <li>Tree surveys, site rehabilitation\u002Frestoration, compensation plans and other arborist duties<\u002Fli> \n    <li>Technical reporting, agency consultation, site meetings and coordination with other business groups<\u002Fli> \n   <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n  <li>Position may include exposure and experience relating to environmental sciences and geology tasks.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <ul> \n  <li>BS or MS with a basic or applied science degree<\u002Fli> \n  <li>10 - 15 years experience, <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Experience leading and mentoring junior and intermediate staff<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>Preferential qualifications would include: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>Backpack Electrofishing, <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Certified Inspector, Sedimentation and Erosion Control (CISEC), Ontario Wetland Evaluation Systems (OWES), <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Ecological Land Classification, <\u002Fli>\n  <li>ISA Certified Arborist, <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Bat Echolocation,<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Butternut Health Assessor (BHA),<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ministry of Transportation (MTO): Fisheries Specialist\u002FContracts Specialist, Terrestrial and Environmental Monitoring during Construction, MTO\u002FDFO\u002FMNRF Fisheries Protocol<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p>#LI-Hybrid<\u002Fp> \n <p>#bia<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <br> \n <i>At Jacobs, we’re challenging today to reinvent tomorrow by solving the world’s most critical problems for thriving cities, resilient environments, mission-critical outcomes, operational advancement, scientific discovery and cutting-edge manufacturing, turning abstract ideas into realities that transform the world for good. <p><i>Our People &amp; Places Solutions business – reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomizes the \"why\" of what we do – the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole. From facilities delivering life-saving therapies and ensuring clean water to enabling the connection of people through all modes of transportation and providing access to technology – we're integrating a multitude of these solution elements to build the smart environments of tomorrow.<\u002Fi><br> <br> <i>Start your Jacobs career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <br> \n <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> At Jacobs we provide the resources to turn great ideas into reality, and we're looking for the most talented and passionate individuals out there to be our next generation of leaders.<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><br> Our Water Resources Solutions and Technology practice provides a focus for advising our clients on resilience and sustainability issues, green solutions and integrated water management across a wide range of water resources strategies that address climate change issues including flood forecasting, analysis and mitigation, water supply management, natural systems protection and restoration, and infrastructure, planning and design.<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><br> To meet our growing Canadian business needs we are looking for a <b>Water Resources Engineer<\u002Fb> in our <b>Toronto<\u002Fb> office. The successful individual will lead and support a range of projects for clients in major public and private sector organizations and will become part of a respected and ambitious company with excellent career prospects and international opportunities. We work closely with colleagues across the company to ensure an integrated and solutions-driven approach to resilience and sustainability.<br> <br> The successful candidate will have design experience related to conventional water resources areas such as drainage design, stormwater management design and low impact development (LID) technology as well as experience in developing climate resilience and adaptation strategies. Good interpersonal skills are essential including the ability to develop effective working relationships with colleagues and clients and to develop and motivate others in the team. You will be working as part of an integrated national resource team.<br> <br> Responsibilities include:<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><br> • Lead, manage or participate in all phases of the design and tendering of Water Resources projects, including conventional stormwater management, infrastructure, roadway\u002Fhighway surface drainage systems, municipal storm sewers, stormwater facilities and LID measures<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><br> • Lead and support proposals and business development efforts<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><br> • Support and collaborate with our Transportation, Transit, Conveyance, and Buildings teams on multi-disciplinary projects and pursuits with water resources components<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><br> • Provide design and project management services for the successful delivery of projects<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><br> • Provide technical leadership for the development and growth of the water resources discipline<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><br> • Have an interest in growing a specialized or dedicated team; coaching, mentoring and assisting junior team members in their career development.<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><br> • Provide quality control and independent review of deliverables<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><br> • Advise clients on the implementation, operation and maintenance of water resources works, including conventional and state-of-the-art stormwater management measures and techniques<\u002Fp> \n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <ul>\n  <li><br> 6+ years of design experience. Any project management experience is a bonus.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><br> • Proficient in the full range of design activities including preparation of functional and detailed design drawings and reports, contract document preparation and tendering<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><br> • Design of surface drainage systems, stormwater management measures and LID features, including, but not limited to hydrology, hydraulics and water quality treatment performance<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><br> • Design and specifications for drainage and stormwater management infrastructure<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><br> • Demonstrable experience with technical report writing. Experience with Environmental Assessments is a bonus.<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><br> <br> The ideal candidate will possess the following skills and experience:<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><br> • Licensed to practice as a professional engineer in Ontario, or eligible to be licensed within six months<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><br> • Thorough knowledge of municipal and provincial review processes and standards for permitting and approvals, including legislation, standards, regulations and guidelines pertaining to storm water services<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><br> • Familiar with GTA design manuals, standards, tools and other water resources guidelines.<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><br> • In-depth understanding of contract administration services and requirements<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><br> • Outstanding abilities in multidisciplinary project teamwork and coordination<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><br> • Strong communication, report writing, organization and interpersonal skills<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><br> • Knowledge of or direct experience with industry standard hydraulic\u002Fhydrologic tools\u002Fmodels, including InfoWorks, PCSWMM, HEC-RAS and ArcGIS<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><br> • Skilled in common desktop applications (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Teams, Project, etc.)<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <br> \n <i>At Jacobs, we’re challenging today to reinvent tomorrow by solving the world’s most critical problems for thriving cities, resilient environments, mission-critical outcomes, operational advancement, scientific discovery and cutting-edge manufacturing, turning abstract ideas into realities that transform the world for good. our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole. From facilities delivering life-saving therapies and ensuring clean water to enabling the connection of people through all modes of transportation and providing access to technology – we're integrating a multitude of these solution elements to build the smart environments of tomorrow.<\u002Fp> \n <p>At Jacobs, effective quality assurance management as well as technical expertise are both crucial to the success of our projects and the strong relationships we have with our clients. The Quality Assurance Coordinator provides quality and project management expertise while also providing the leadership and people skills necessary to effectively progress highly complex and challenging issues. We are looking for someone with a knowledge of Quality Assurance strategies and relevant industry practices, able to support the project delivery team as part of the closeout of a large P3 project. Good understanding of engineering and construction technical challenges within transit, roadway or tunneling projects would be an asset. It will be possible to optimize the role based the strengths and qualifications that successful candidates bring to the table.<\u002Fp> \n <p>We're looking for a passionate Quality Assurance Coordinator in Greater Toronto Area (GTA) who is excited about working on projects that enable the heart of our client’s business. The Quality Assurance Coordinator is directly responsible for managing interfaces across multiple organizations and teams, providing the expertise and leadership that is required to support the Project Delivery team through the Substantial Completion process. In this position you’ll own your career as you work on some of the most innovative projects of our time.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Duties and Responsibilities:<\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  Providing support to and under the direction of, the project Quality Compliance Lead, through coordination, liaison, and integration with the Project Delivery Teams and External QA teams\u002Frepresentatives:\n  <br> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Assist in the continual development of the clients Project Quality Assurance Plan (PQAP), collecting project information, conducting research, and coordinating information, Coordinating, and maintaining information inputs and outputs of the Quality Assurance Audits program.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Participating and\u002For assisting in Quality Assurance audits (Internal and External).<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Assist in the development of QA Audit Plans and Schedules, inputting data and producing Audit Reports for review, and identifying audit findings.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Creating and maintaining QA Deliverables tracking logs as required to monitor Contractor’s QMS’ and External Consultant’s QA Deliverables, Drafting, reviewing, monitoring, and reporting on Non-Conformances identified from Quality Assurance audits and QA inspections within the Contract Management System,<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Initiate Non-Conformance Reports (NCRs) and provide technical quality opinion on the correction and corrective actions that are presented by the design-builder’s<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Follow-up and reporting on Corrective Actions and updating Audit and NCR logs accordingly.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Assist in the review of Consultants and Contractors’ Quality Management Plans (QMP), Quality Assurance Plans (QAP), ITPs and Other Quality Deliverables; and provide feed-back and comments to quality document submittals.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Maintaining documentation of QA compliance activities, tracking QA deliverables of the various parties to the projects, and collecting, compiling, and reporting QA KRAs and KPIs within various quality dashboards and reports.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Attending and\u002For facilitating internal and external Quality meetings representing the project quality function: including Contractor Quality Coordination Meetings, Quality Workshops and Lessons Learned Workshops and recording and preparing Minutes of Meetings as required.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Assist in the development and provision of Quality Assurance Training at the sub-program and project level, with the objective of raising awareness of quality across the sub-program, inducting all Parties to the Projects to the projects PQAP quality objectives, policies, and procedures. Creating, maintaining, and reporting on associated QA training logs.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n <\u002Fdiv> \n <div>\n  Leadership\u002FRelationship\u002FStakeholder\u002FInterfaces\n  <br> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Work with multiple Project Delivery Teams, External Consultants, Contractors and 3rd Party Inspection and Testing Agencies<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Develop a collaborative approach across all teams to encourage improvements in quality performance<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n <\u002Fdiv> \n <div>\n  Project Delivery Knowledge:\n  <br> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Good knowledge of ISO requirements, particularly ISO 9001:2015<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Fundamental understanding of Quality Management Systems<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Strong report writing and advanced MX Excel and database knowledge<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n <\u002Fdiv> \n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> Education\u002FExperience:<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>BS degree, certificate from technical program, or skills and experience commensurate and relevant experience.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>3 to 7 years’ direct QA\u002FQC coordination experience preferred.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Certified ISO 9001:2015 Quality Lead Auditor<\u002Fli>\n  <li>IRCA\u002FIQA Registered Lead Assessor preferred.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <br> \n <i>At Jacobs, we’re challenging today to reinvent tomorrow by solving the world’s most critical problems for thriving cities, resilient environments, mission-critical outcomes, operational advancement, scientific discovery and cutting-edge manufacturing, turning abstract ideas into realities that transform the world for good.
