<p><i>Our People &amp; Places Solutions business – reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomizes the \"why\" of what we do – the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole. From facilities delivering life-saving therapies and ensuring clean water to enabling the connection of people through all modes of transportation and providing access to technology – we're integrating a multitude of these solution elements to build the smart environments of tomorrow.<\u002Fi><br> <br> <i>Start your Jacobs career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <br> \n <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> At Jacobs, Quality Assurance is crucial to the success of our projects and the strong relationships we have with our clients. As an experienced Project Quality Assurance Lead, you’ll work on specifying the quality requirements during tendering phase and developing and implementing an effective quality assurance plan during development and implementation phase identifying KPIs, processes, procedures, audit programs and other control measures, through which monitor quality performance of all parties and make them accountable to their contractual obligations with regards to quality. You’ll have the support, means and space to deliver your best work, today and into tomorrow.<br> <br> Based in Toronto, you’ll have the chance to use communication and negotiation skills to guide, influence, and convince others, interact internally with Project Delivery Teams and multiple departments in corporate offices, and externally with different contractual parties involved in the project, such as Prime Contractor, Technical Advisor, Third-Party Utility companies, municipalities, delivery partners, and any other consultants and subconsultants hired by Owner for successful delivery of the project. You’ll own your career as you work on some of the most innovative projects of our time.<br> <\u002Fp>\n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <ul>\n  <li><br> At least 10 years’ experience working in the Quality Assurance field within heavy civil or industrial projects.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Bachelor’s degree in Engineering (preferably Civil Engineering) or equivalent certified technical training.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Validate all the project Non-Conformance Reports (NCRs) that are identified by the contractor, the field QA Services consultant, or by the integrated project delivery team.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Monitor and manage the NCRs and provide technical quality decisions with respect to verification, correction, and corrective actions.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Good understanding of different type of contracts, including P3 and Non-P3, progressive (collaborative) contracts such as Alliance, as well as Transit Oriented Communities (TOC), and Construction at Risk.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Ability to read and understand engineering drawings.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <br> Ideally, You’ll Also Have:\n <br> \n <br> \n <ul>\n  <li>An understanding of local building and Engineering codes and standards.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>ASQ Certified Quality Auditor, IRCA\u002FIQA Registered Lead.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Professional Engineering registration is preferred.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>PMP certification is preferred.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <br> \n <i>At Jacobs, we’re challenging today to reinvent tomorrow by solving the world’s most critical problems for thriving cities, resilient environments, mission-critical outcomes, operational advancement, scientific discovery and cutting-edge manufacturing, turning abstract ideas into realities that transform the world for good. With $13 billion in revenue and a talent force of more than 55,000, Jacobs provides a full spectrum of professional services including consulting, technical, scientific and project delivery for the government and private In this role you’ll have the opportunity to utilize your technical leadership and knowledge in process and mechanical engineering design of systems for municipal water and wastewater treatment facilities and pumping stations.\n  <br> \n  <br> \n  <ul>\n   <li>As the Process Mechanical Design Engineer, you’ll lead process and mechanical engineering teams in the design of municipal water and wastewater treatment plants, conduct technical studies and strategic planning, and pumping stations.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>You’ll provide technical leadership in the area of process mechanical engineering both locally and regionally and advocate the use of advance engineering and automation tools in the design.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>You’ll provide design coordination between multiple engineering disciplines and expert advice to internal and external clients, including performing process and equipment condition assessments at water and wastewater treatment facilities and pumping stations.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>You will create engineering calculations and specifications and oversee the creation of engineering drawings.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>You’ll be responsible for the project discipline engineering budget, as well as the project’s discipline schedule and quality of deliverables.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>You will be working closely with sales team for preparing level of effort and technical proposal writing.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful> \n  <br> As a passionate design lead, you’ll leverage your people management skills to help your team members discover what drives them, nurturing their purpose and guiding them forward. <p><i>Our People &amp; Places Solutions business – reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomizes the \"why\" of what we do – the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole. From facilities delivering life-saving therapies and ensuring clean water to enabling the connection of people through all modes of transportation and providing access to technology – we're integrating a multitude of these solution elements to build the smart environments of tomorrow.<\u002Fi><br> <br> <i>Start your Jacobs career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <br> \n <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <div>\n  <br> At Jacobs, we’re partnering across the globe to create the best project outcomes by maximizing the design, digital technology, and support capabilities of our Global Integrated Delivery (GID) teammates. By joining Jacobs, you’ll commit to supporting and engaging with these teams, as we work to build a company like no other.\n  <br> \n  <br> We have an exciting opportunity for a \n  <b>Process Mechanical Design Engineer <\u002Fb>position in our \n  <b>Edmonton <\u002Fb>or\n  <b> Calgary office<\u002Fb>. In this role you’ll have the opportunity to utilize your technical leadership and knowledge in process and mechanical engineering design of systems for municipal water and wastewater treatment facilities and pumping stations.\n  <br> \n  <br> \n  <ul>\n   <li>As the Process Mechanical Design Engineer, you’ll lead process and mechanical engineering teams in the design of municipal water and wastewater treatment plants, conduct technical studies and strategic planning, and pumping stations.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>You’ll provide technical leadership in the area of process mechanical engineering both locally and regionally and advocate the use of advance engineering and automation tools in the design.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>You’ll provide design coordination between multiple engineering disciplines and expert advice to internal and external clients, including performing process and equipment condition assessments at water and wastewater treatment facilities and pumping stations.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>You will create engineering calculations and specifications and oversee the creation of engineering drawings.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>You’ll be responsible for the project discipline engineering budget, as well as the project’s discipline schedule and quality of deliverables.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>You will be working closely with sales team for preparing level of effort and technical proposal writing.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful> \n  <br> As a passionate design lead, you’ll leverage your people management skills to help your team members discover what drives them, nurturing their purpose and guiding them forward. Most importantly, you’ll take action to ensure the safety, health and well-being of your team and our planet.\n  <br> \n  <i> <\u002Fi>\n  <br> \n  <i>You will be working mainly from home (unless you prefer coming into our office), with the expectation to travel for client \u002Fsite meetings and occasional team meetings.<\u002Fi>\n <\u002Fdiv> \n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <ul> \n  <li>Bachelor’s degree in Civil, Environmental, Mechanical or Chemical Engineering.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Holds (or eligible for) Association of Professional Engineers and Geoscientists of Alberta (APEGA) membership.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Process modelling experience with modelling software (e.g. Biowin and\u002For Sumo).<\u002Fli> \n  <li>At least 12 years’ experience in design and commissioning of systems for process-mechanical municipal facilities or similar type water and wastewater treatment facilities.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Positive attitude, dependable, with the ability to work independently as well as part of a team to meet deadlines and provide a high quality of work and mentorship and development of staff.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience with Design Build Project is an asset.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience functioning as Design Manager for water and wastewater treatment plant design projects is an asset.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Desire to grow personally as well as professionally with each new process \u002Fprocess mechanical engineering task.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p>#LI-Hybrid<\u002Fp> \n <p>#bia<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <br> \n <i>At Jacobs, we’re challenging today to reinvent tomorrow by solving the world’s most critical problems for thriving cities, resilient environments, mission-critical outcomes, operational advancement, scientific discovery and cutting-edge manufacturing, turning abstract ideas into realities that transform the world for good. <p><i>Our People &amp; Places Solutions business – reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomizes the \"why\" of what we do – the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole. From facilities delivering life-saving therapies and ensuring clean water to enabling the connection of people through all modes of transportation and providing access to technology – we're integrating a multitude of these solution elements to build the smart environments of tomorrow.<\u002Fi><br> <br> <i>Start your Jacobs career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <br> \n <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <div>\n   At Jacobs, we challenge what is currently accepted, so we can shape innovative and lasting solutions for tomorrow. If you’re interested in a long term and rewarding career working with the #1 globally ranked water treatment engineering firm, and with the industry’s best and most innovative engineers, then Jacobs is where you belong.\n <\u002Fdiv> \n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  We have an exciting opportunity for a \n  <b>Senior Process Mechanical Design Engineer \u002FDesign Manager <\u002Fb>position. In this role you’ll have the opportunity to utilize your technical leadership and knowledge in process and mechanical engineering design of systems for municipal water and wastewater treatment facilities and pumping stations.\n <\u002Fdiv> \n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  As the Process Mechanical Design Lead, you’ll lead process and mechanical engineering teams in the design of large municipal water and wastewater treatment plants and pumping stations. You’ll provide technical leadership in the area of process mechanical engineering both locally and regionally and advocate the use of advance engineering and automation tools in the design. You’ll provide design coordination between multiple engineering disciplines and expert advice to internal and external clients, including performing process and equipment condition assessments at water and wastewater treatment facilities and pumping stations. You’ll be responsible for the projects engineering budget, as well as the project’s schedule and quality of deliverables.\n <\u002Fdiv> \n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  As a passionate design lead, you’ll leverage your people management skills to help your team members discover what drives them, nurturing their purpose and guiding them forward. Most importantly, you’ll take action to ensure the safety, health and well-being of your team and our planet.\n <\u002Fdiv> \n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <i>You will be working mainly from home (unless you prefer coming into our <\u002Fi>\n  <b><i>Toronto or Kitchener <\u002Fi><\u002Fb>\n  <i>office), with the expectation to travel for client \u002Fsite meetings and occasional team meetings.<\u002Fi>\n <\u002Fdiv> \n <div>\n  <p>We are invested in you and your success. Our values stand on a foundation of safety, integrity, inclusion and diversity. We put people at the heart of our business and we truly believe that by supporting one another through our culture of caring, we all succeed. We value positive mental health and a sense of belonging for all employees. We aim to make inclusion and diversity core attributes of our identity, embedded in all our employment and business practices in all locations. We know that if we are inclusive, we’re more connected, and if we are diverse, we’re more creative.<br> <br> As a Disability Confident employer, we will interview all disabled applicants who meet the minimum criteria for a vacancy. We welcome applications from candidates who are seeking flexible working and from those who may not meet all the listed requirements for a role.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Bring your curiosity, passion for innovation, and talent for multi-tasking in a fast-paced environment. We’ll help you grow, pursue and fulfill what inspires you – so we can make big impacts on the world, together.<\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <div> \n  <ul>\n   <li> Bachelor’s degree in Civil, Environmental, Mechanical or Chemical Engineering<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful> \n  <ul>\n   <li> Holds (or eligible for) Professional Engineers Ontario membership<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful> \n  <ul>\n   <li> At least 15 years’ experience in design, construction management and commissioning of systems for process-mechanical municipal facilities or similar type water and wastewater treatment facilities<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful> \n  <ul>\n   <li> Positive attitude, dependable, with the ability to work independently as well as part of a team to meet deadlines and provide a high quality of work and mentorship and development of staff<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful> \n  <ul>\n   <li> Experience with Design Build Project is an asset<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful> \n  <ul>\n   <li> Experience functioning as Design Manager for water and wastewater treatment plant design projects is an asset.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful> \n  <ul>\n   <li> Process modelling experience with modelling software (e.g. Biowin) is an asset<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful> \n  <ul>\n   <li> Desire to grow personally as well as professionally with each new process \u002Fprocess mechanical engineering task<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  #li-gs1\n <\u002Fdiv> \n <div>\n  #bia\n <\u002Fdiv> \n <div>\n  #gbo\n <\u002Fdiv> \n <br> \n <i>At Jacobs, we’re challenging today to reinvent tomorrow by solving the world’s most critical problems for thriving cities, resilient environments, mission-critical outcomes, operational advancement, scientific discovery and cutting-edge manufacturing, turning abstract ideas into realities that transform the world for good. You’ll develop advanced engineering concepts, techniques, and will maintain effective communication with project team members and with the customer. <p><i>Our People &amp; Places Solutions business – reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomizes the \"why\" of what we do – the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole. From facilities delivering life-saving therapies and ensuring clean water to enabling the connection of people through all modes of transportation and providing access to technology – we're integrating a multitude of these solution elements to build the smart environments of tomorrow.<\u002Fi><br> <br> <i>Start your Jacobs career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <br> \n <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> At Jacobs, we’re partnering across the globe to create the best project outcomes by maximizing the design, digital technology, and support capabilities of our Global Integrated Delivery (GID) teammates. By joining Jacobs, you’ll commit to supporting and engaging with these teams, as we work to build a company like no other.<\u002Fp> \n <p>As a Project Manager within our Environmental Solution market, you’ll have the chance to manage projects that support the development and implementation of environmental compliance data management solutions for our industrial clients.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Based out of one of our Canadian offices, you’ll be working with other members of our team, you’ll be the face of Jacobs as you lead multi-discipline teams of client and consulting staff in developing enterprise environmental, health, and safety (EHS) compliance data management solutions. You and your teams will provide onsite and remote support to assist the client in defining environmental reporting needs and solution specifications and requirements. Bring your expertise in project management, EHS compliance, and information management as well as a desire to conserve our natural resources, and we’ll empower you to deliver the boldest solutions for our clients.<\u002Fp> \n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <ul> \n  <li>Experience with environmental regulatory compliance.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Project Management experience with delivery of small, medium, or large-scale client environmental compliance consulting projects.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Bachelor’s Degree in Environmental Engineering or Sciences, including but not limited to Chemical Engineering, Civil Engineering, Computer Science, or related degree with an environmental focus.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>Ideally, You’ll Also Have:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Demonstrated business development and client service skills, including ability to participate in sales efforts, close deals, manage scope changes and write proposals.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Demonstrated understanding and experience managing contracts, scopes of work, and project financials, including various metrics.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Demonstrated experience in delivering projects on time and within budget that met client technical and quality expectations.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Demonstrated project management and execution success on environmental compliance projects including implementation of work plans, setting budgets, and developing project schedules as well as proven experience in leading teams of technical specialists to develop sustainable environmental solutions with clients.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience leading EHS software implementations, including design workshops, development, testing, and post-go-live support.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience with ArcGIS, Cority\u002FEnviance, ehsAI, Enablon, EQuIS, Gensuite, Intelex\u002FACTS, SerenityEHS, Sphera, and\u002For others.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Regulatory familiarity with environmental reporting, spill prevention\u002Fplanning, stormwater, water discharge, emissions, air modeling, waste generation and reduction, carbon reporting, safety events and near misses, injury\u002Fillness reporting, EHS risk management, process safety management, health and safety reporting, industrial hygiene, occupational health, internal and regulatory auditing.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience with and understanding of different project management methodologies (e.g., Agile \u002F Scrum, Waterfall).<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Project Management Professional (PMP) certification.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <i>At Jacobs, we’re challenging today to reinvent tomorrow by solving the world’s most critical problems for thriving cities, resilient environments, mission-critical outcomes, operational advancement, scientific discovery and cutting-edge manufacturing, turning abstract ideas into realities that transform the world for good. With $13 billion in revenue and a talent force of more than 55,000, Jacobs provides a full spectrum of professional services including consulting, technical, scientific and project delivery for the government and private <p><i>Our People &amp; Places Solutions business – reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomizes the \"why\" of what we do – the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole. From facilities delivering life-saving therapies and ensuring clean water to enabling the connection of people through all modes of transportation and providing access to technology – we're integrating a multitude of these solution elements to build the smart environments of tomorrow.<\u002Fi><br> <br> <i>Start your Jacobs career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <br> \n <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> The energy industry, particularly transmission grids, is undergoing major transformations to accommodate for regional and global decarbonization and energy transition targets. The Jacobs Transmission and Distribution (T&amp;D) team provides a wide range of services to major global and North American transmission and distribution clients ranging from major utilities to renewable energy developers. Our team has a strong focus on innovation and supporting industries and organisations driving the decarbonisation of our energy systems.<\u002Fp> \n <p>So, we are looking for a Senior or Principal Power Systems Engineer to join our growing T&amp;D team in North America. The successful candidate will effectively support our business by delivering high-quality work related to power systems studies as well as helping grow our overall business in this space. This will include system modelling and performing various power system studies for our major energy clients worldwide, including performing bulk transmission system planning studies (load flow\u002Fcontingency analysis, short circuit, dynamics etc.). General knowledge of North American RTO\u002FISO requirements, transmission system planning and interconnection processes (FERC\u002FNERC standards), as well as other bulk system requirements would be required to perform duties of this role.<\u002Fp> \n <p>The ideal candidate should have a strong electrical\u002Fpower systems background, a strong in-depth knowledge in technology (inverter-based resources), power system modelling and analysis, a methodical approach to problem solving and ability to utilise their skills to support growth in our business and our people.<br> <br> The successful candidate will also be able to work collaboratively with our global power systems teams (primarily based in the UK and ANZ), as well as provide client focus and support, innovative solutions to clients most challenging problems, connect and nurture our technical resources.<\u002Fp> \n <p>This position is flexible and can be remote anywhere in North America. However, preference would be given to candidate located in Toronto, Vancouver, or Dallas\u002FFort Worth US.<\u002Fp> \n <p>The role of Senior\u002FPrincipal Power Systems Engineer in our Energy &amp; Power team in North America is one of the components of a growth strategy to position Jacobs as a leader in supporting our clients energy transition activities within North America as well as global.<\u002Fp> \n <p>As part of our team, you’ll be providing a range of services throughout the Power System study projects, including power system modelling, feasibility studies, Grid Code compliance studies, grid interconnection\u002Fimpact studies, Insulation Coordination, technical reports, technical bid preparation, attend the customer meetings etc.<\u002Fp> \n <p>As this is a Senior\u002FPrincipal role, you will also be required to lead the technical discipline at the senior level, delivering innovative solutions that provide superior value to our clients.<\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  Key responsibilities include:\n  <br> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Transmission planning system studies including, but not limited to load flow\u002Fcontingency analysis, generator injection analysis (network upgrades etc.), short circuit, VRT\u002FFRT and dynamic studies.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Other general electrical design studies including protection coordination, harmonics, grounding etc.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Lead\u002Fsupport system studies project(s) throughout the whole lifecycle (i.e. from the technical bid\u002Fproposal to execution, reports, client meetings\u002Fpresentations, to close-out)<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Contribute to the delivery of projects, delivering on time and to budget<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Ensure the studies\u002Fdesign meets all the applicable technical requirements<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Work closely with the team members across North America and globally.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Work with different types of customers including renewable developers and RTOs\u002FISOs.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Act as main point of contact and\u002For liaise directly with our clients, contractors, operators, and suppliers as necessary.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Mentor and train other junior engineers\u002Fstaff.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Support the sales &amp; management in client engagement and business development opportunities in pursuit of future work for the business<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n <\u002Fdiv> \n <p>Jacobs is a “Relationship” focused company and the building and developing of these relationships with our clients is a significant and important part of this role.<\u002Fp> \n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <ul>\n  <li><br> You must enjoy working in a multi-national team environment and be able to use your expertise to guide other members of staff. You’ll also require the ability to deliver to tight timescales, be technically accurate and to manage a number of schemes simultaneously.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Strong verbal and written communication skills combined, and quantitative and problem-solving skills are essential as part of this role.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Jacobs have a strong ethos for safety in our BeyondZero approach, so you would be expected to have a positive attitude to health and safety, especially to eliminate or reduce the risk early in the design process.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>Bachelor degree or equivalent in electrical engineering or power systems.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Substantial postgraduate years of related work experience in utility and\u002For renewable projects.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Past experience performing transmission planning studies, injection studies, or similar based on a North American RTO\u002FISO requirements and interconnection processes (FERC\u002FNERC standards) is a must. Examples (non-exhaustive): IESO, NYISO, ISO-NE, PJM, MISO, ERCOT, CAISO etc.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Membership of a recognised professional association (IEEE or CIGRE) and recognition with PEng\u002FPE or be able\u002Fwilling to obtain.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Advanced proficiency in power system modelling and analysis using PSS\u002FE, ETAP and PSCAD.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Strong communication skills to articulate a clear technical direction with good social, networking and presentation skills.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>A strong team player.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>A strong technical bias, a keen interest in technology and Power System modelling, a methodical approach to problem solving.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Willingness to work in customer centric environment.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Willing to work in multi-disciplinary activities.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <p>Ideally, You’ll Also Have:<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Ability to use MATLAB\u002FPython to streamline studies is preferable.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Willingness to learn and grow in new areas.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Able to generate innovative ideas.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <p>Our Culture<\u002Fp> \n <p>At Jacobs we see safety differently - we strive to go ‘BeyondZero’ by putting the health, safety and well-being of our employees first in everything we do.<\u002Fp> \n <p>We are committed to equality across our business and we work with external organisations such as STEM, WISE (Women in Science &amp; Engineering) and Stonewall. We are also Disability Confident Committed; therefore, we guarantee to interview all disabled applicants who meet the minimum criteria for a vacancy.<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <br> \n <i>At Jacobs, we’re challenging today to reinvent tomorrow by solving the world’s most critical problems for thriving cities, resilient environments, mission-critical outcomes, operational advancement, scientific discovery and cutting-edge manufacturing, turning abstract ideas into realities that transform the world for good. With $13 billion in revenue and a talent force of more than 55,000, Jacobs provides a full spectrum of professional services including consulting, technical, scientific and project delivery for the <p><i>Our People &amp; Places Solutions business – reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomizes the \"why\" of what we do – the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole. From facilities delivering life-saving therapies and ensuring clean water to enabling the connection of people through all modes of transportation and providing access to technology – we're integrating a multitude of these solution elements to build the smart environments of tomorrow.<\u002Fi><br> <br> <i>Start your Jacobs career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <br> \n <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> At Jacobs, you’ll work for a company that strives to provide opportunities for employees to learn, grow and thrive, within a supportive culture that values diversity and inclusion. You will have the opportunity to enhance quality of life via the work you do to facilitate the construction of key capital projects. <\u002Fp>\n <p>Based in British Columbia (aligned to the Burnaby office), you will manage a team implementing the environmental regulatory requirements of a major infrastructure project. Your team will consist of qualified environmental professionals on a fast-paced, multi-stakeholder Project, where our delivery responsibilities include verifying environmental compliance with environmental plans and permit conditions and working collaboratively with clients, their stakeholders, and construction contractors. As Project Manager, you will be responsible for meeting client objectives and project-specific internal financial goals. You will be challenged to build efficient delivery teams that produce high quality work and to develop client relationships that facilitate expanding the depth and breadth of our services. All of this will be accomplished in a supportive team setting, with help and guidance from fellow PMs, operations leader mentors, training opportunities, client account managers, and talent supervisors. Global technical practice leaders will assist you to bring the right tools and approaches and newest innovations to our clients. Your success will be rewarded with progressively more responsibility and commensurate financial recognition and career advancement. <\u002Fp>\n <p>The position may require frequent presence at a project office in the Vancouver area, for a multi-year project. Outside of that, there is no requirement to be in the Burnaby office. Jacobs supports flexible work arrangements, including work from home. <\u002Fp>\n <p>At Jacobs, we’re partnering across the globe to create the best project outcomes by maximizing the design, digital technology, and support capabilities of our Global Integrated Delivery (GID) teammates. By joining Jacobs, you’ll commit to supporting and engaging with these teams, as we work to build a company like no other<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <ul> \n  <li>Bachelor’s degree in an environmental, science or engineering-related field<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Professional experience in the environmental sector, including multiple years managing complex projects with multi-disciplinary teams and multi-stakeholder engagement<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Demonstrated construction-based management experience<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Excellent communication, negotiation and conflict resolution skills <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Prior work in the oil and gas sector is an asset<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience overseeing the implementation of environmental management plans during construction<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience in southwestern British Columbia<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience working with construction contractors<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience managing subcontractors<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Qualified professional status in a related area<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience overseeing health and safety programs prior to and during construction<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <i>At Jacobs, we’re challenging today to reinvent tomorrow by solving the world’s most critical problems for thriving cities, resilient environments, mission-critical outcomes, operational advancement, scientific discovery and cutting-edge manufacturing, turning abstract ideas into realities that transform the world for good. With $13 billion in revenue and a talent force of more than 55,000, Jacobs provides a full spectrum of professional services including consulting, technical, scientific and project delivery for the <p><i>Our People &amp; Places Solutions business – reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomizes the \"why\" of what we do – the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole. From facilities delivering life-saving therapies and ensuring clean water to enabling the connection of people through all modes of transportation and providing access to technology – we're integrating a multitude of these solution elements to build the smart environments of tomorrow.<\u002Fi><br> <br> <i>Start your Jacobs career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <br> \n <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> At Jacobs, we’re partnering across the globe to create the best project outcomes by maximizing the design, digital technology, and support capabilities of our Global Integrated Delivery (GID) teammates. By joining Jacobs, you’ll commit to supporting and engaging with these teams, as we work to build a company like no other.<br> <\u002Fp>\n <p>The <b>Senior Client Account Partner (CAP)<\u002Fb> is an integral position within Jacobs’ People &amp; Places Solutions Growth &amp; Sales organization in the Americas. As the CAP, you’ll work closely with our Client Account Leadership to expand our established water market. Most CAPs have held roles of increasing responsibility in the field of proposal management and sales strategy and are considered proven and effective leaders on all sizes of pursuits.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Your primary responsibilities will include partnering with Client Account Leadership to develop and drive sales strategy through market and industry research, leadership, communication, organization, and planning on both an account and opportunity level. You’ll be the primary pursuit lead on strategic opportunities leading a broader team of proposal managers, graphic designers, and document publishers. You’ll also be responsible for writing the corporate qualifications sections and collaborating with subject matter experts on the technical sections of an opportunity.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>Your main duties \u002Fresponsibilities will include:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Building a solid understanding of regional and local office qualifications, markets, clients, partners, and competitors; knowledgeable of corporate offerings, markets, and best practices<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Partnering with sales leadership to drive growth and demonstrates client advocacy and leadership on assigned accounts<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Partnering with Client Account Leadership(s) on strategic account(s) and\u002For market(s) to develop account plans, track opportunities, understand client priorities, and set sales strategies, as well as on go\u002Fno-go and bid\u002Fno-bid discussions and opportunity risk reviews<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Driving consistent sales strategies and key account messaging that promote the Jacobs brand<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Leading the planning and positioning activities for opportunities that are &lt;$100K-$10M in revenue; participating in planning activities for pursuits that are &gt;$10M in revenue, in coordination with a Strategic Pursuit Leader<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Managing the proposal development process for large, strategic pursuits from kick-off, storyboarding, sales and technical writing, compliance reviews, and production<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <ul>\n  <li>Leading presentation development, including theme statements, winning attributes and feature\u002Fbenefit\u002Fproof slides. Working with subject matter experts on content development and graphic designers on overall look. Organizing rehearsals, that include developing practice questions and answers as well as coaching speakers in presentation skills<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Championing and adhering to Jacobs branding and editing standards, data management best practices, as well as other standard tools and processes<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Coaching and mentoring other CAPs and proposal staff, as well as providing broad technical or functional guidance and leadership to others<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <ul> \n  <li>Detailed understanding of and experience with relationship-based sales processes, systems, and tools<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Relevant experience within the architecture, engineering, construction industry preferably with a focus on water infrastructure and resiliency.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Strong leader with ability to marshal resources (people, material, support), solve problems, and work collaboratively with a team in a fast-paced environment; ability to handle multiple, simultaneous projects and work under strict deadlines is required<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Team player with great interpersonal skills and ability to develop, nurture, and maintain relationships at all levels with the company<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to maintain a sense of humor under pressure a must<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Proven ability to organize, direct, and motivate a multidiscipline pursuit team to develop strategic sales deliverables<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Demonstrated ability to communicate complex concepts in easy to read and compelling text<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Self-motivated with a willingness to take initiative and solve complex problems<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Capability to negotiate with and influence others<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Desire to be an integral part of creating change by embracing our industry leading company culture that is focused on inclusion, diversity, and environmental change<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Committed to supporting company strategic goals and maintaining profitable growth<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Thorough knowledge of desktop publishing software, including Microsoft Word and Adobe Acrobat; proficiency in specialized applications, such as Adobe InDesign, a plus<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Proficient in using SalesForce for account planning and opportunity management<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Education and\u002For training related to business, sales, marketing, communications, engineering, science, or related field preferred<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p>#li-gs1<\u002Fp> \n <p>#bia<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <br> \n <i>At Jacobs, we’re challenging today to reinvent tomorrow by solving the world’s most critical problems for thriving cities, resilient environments, mission-critical outcomes, operational advancement, scientific discovery and cutting-edge manufacturing, turning abstract ideas into realities that transform the world for good. <p><i>Our People &amp; Places Solutions business – reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomizes the \"why\" of what we do – the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole. From facilities delivering life-saving therapies and ensuring clean water to enabling the connection of people through all modes of transportation and providing access to technology – we're integrating a multitude of these solution elements to build the smart environments of tomorrow.<\u002Fi><br> <br> <i>Start your Jacobs career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <br> \n <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> As a Senior Transit Vehicle Specialist, you’ll provide Engineering leadership and support for a variety of transit vehicle projects. The role will provide a wide variety of administrative and technical support services. You’ll work with other members of our team by providing leadership and support in the following areas: specification writing, vehicle field testing and evaluation, reliability assessments, design reviews and production quality oversight.<\u002Fp> \n <p>We’ll ask you to work on projects that will include the procurement of new or overhauled transit vehicles and related projects with a focus on Buses, Light Rail Vehicles and Heavy Rail Vehicles. As a Senior team member, you may be involved with field implementation and testing activities for a range of transit vehicles and support system integration of transit vehicle subsystems. You’ll have opportunities to communicate and interact with Rail and Bus Manufacturers and local contractors to resolve technical issues and provide engineering expertise. We’ll rely on you to lead and support the wider team with preparation of technical reports on complex technical equipment problems, failure trends and fleet reliability issues, as well as investigate any part failures or maintenance issues. You will be part of a team that will use judgement-based experiences to evaluate situations and develop solutions, while working independently to achieve individual assignment outcomes while managing your personal workload.<\u002Fp> \n <p>You’ll be a part of diverse multi-discipline teams allowing you to both share what you know and learn so you can grow. Join us and we will assist you in continued development of your skills and exploring all that you can do across our global company.<br> <\u002Fp>\n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <ul>\n  <li><br> Bachelor of Applied Science \u002F Engineering (or equivalent)<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Minimum 10+ years of experience in the Transit industry<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Knowledgeable of the concepts and practices of Transit vehicles and component testing programs and procedures is an asset<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Work with project delivery leadership who provide oversight and mentoring. Support the development of team members, regardless of individual experiences (both technical and non-technical) through active coaching and mentoring<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Completes the scope of work to the satisfaction of our clients, while simultaneously ensuring that Jacob’s HS&amp;E, quality, financial, risk management, business and policy expectations are met.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Support business development activities leading to the award of further contracts. This typically includes client relationship development, project-specific position activities, proposal preparation, orals presentation, and contract negotiation consistent with established business development processes.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>May execute special or continuous research in support of a project, collect data and analyze complex problems associated with a project, or departmental projects. For example, being part of a team that may propose and\u002For evaluate proposed system improvements with regards to availability of proven technologies in the market, risk, cost, integration, and configuration constraints of Transit vehicles such as space envelope, power, etc.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Demonstrated Project Management Experience; PMP is an asset<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Excellent written and verbal communications skills, and the ability to communicate technical information to non-technical audiences.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p>Ideally, you'll also have:<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <div>\n  <br> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Registration as P.Eng. in Ontario<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <br> \n <br> \n <i>At Jacobs, we’re challenging today to reinvent tomorrow by solving the world’s most critical problems for thriving cities, resilient environments, mission-critical outcomes, operational advancement, scientific discovery and cutting-edge manufacturing, turning abstract ideas into realities that transform the world for good. <p><i>Our People &amp; Places Solutions business – reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomizes the \"why\" of what we do – the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole. From facilities delivering life-saving therapies and ensuring clean water to enabling the connection of people through all modes of transportation and providing access to technology – we're integrating a multitude of these solution elements to build the smart environments of tomorrow.<\u002Fi><br> <br> <i>Start your Jacobs career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <br> \n <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> At Jacobs, we’re partnering across the globe to create the best project outcomes by maximizing the design, digital technology, and support capabilities of our Global Integrated Delivery (GID) teammates. By joining, Jacobs, you’ll commit to supporting and engaging with these teams, as we work to build a company like no other.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Jacobs is currently looking to hire an entry to intermediate Environmental Planner based out of the western Canadian offices (Calgary, Vancouver or Edmonton) to join our dynamic team. This position provides technical leadership and guidance to our multi-disciplinary (environment practitioners) teams during the design, construction and operations of infrastructure projects in western Canada relative to regulatory requirements, environmental due diligence and planning.<\u002Fp> \n <p>The successful candidate will join our Global Environmental Solutions group and will work as part of multi-disciplinary project teams to oversee the environmental permitting and planning efforts of government and privately owned infrastructure projects. You’ll support environmental planning and permitting work with a multi-disciplinary team throughout the life cycle of a project. Oversee the preparation of environmental assessments, permit and regulatory filings, and environmental management plans. Coordinate and provide technical writing support for environmental assessments for projects and programs. Includes coordinating the completion of subject specific environmental studies. Supporting engagement efforts with Indigenous communities, stakeholders and regulatory agencies. Establish and maintain relationships with members of the public, government and non-government communities, associations, tenure holders and Indigenous communities. In a collaborative manner, develop and expand our client portfolio, including support for Business Development and proposal efforts. Develop staff through on-the-job mentorship.<\u002Fp> \n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>B.Sc. (required) or M.Sc. (preferred) in a Natural Resources related field (biology, ecology, forestry, or geography)<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Related experience in the natural resources sector in Canada, preferably in BC and in a consulting environment.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Familiarity with environmental acts, such as the Canadian Environmental Assessment Act, National Energy Board Act, Environmental Protection and Enhancement Act, and the Public Lands Act is considered an asset.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience seeing major projects from planning through construction considered an asset.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Strong technical writing skills is required. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Experience working on Provincially regulated projects in Alberta and British Columbia, including a strong understanding of permitting energy development projects regulated by the Alberta Energy Regulator, Alberta Environment and Parks, BC Oil and Gas Commission, and BC Environmental Assessment Office. Experience working on federally regulated energy projects in Western Canada, including experience working on projects regulated by the National Energy Board.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Construction based environmental monitoring experience is an asset.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p>Ideally, You’ll Also Have:<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Requires a high level of initiative and problem-solving.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Team player with strong interpersonal and communication skills with proficiency in written and spoken English to communicate effectively with internal and external stakeholders and prepare technical reports.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to work on multiple projects with strong organizational and time management skills.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Demonstrated ability to work under minimal supervision.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <i>At Jacobs, we’re challenging today to reinvent tomorrow by solving the world’s most critical problems for thriving cities, resilient environments, mission-critical outcomes, operational advancement, scientific discovery and cutting-edge manufacturing, turning abstract ideas into realities that transform the world for good. What we do is more than consulting; we play a part in moving a vision from concept to reality. We work every day to create the spaces people live in and the infrastructure to improve their lives. <\u002Fp>\n <p>If you want to join a company where you can have tangible impact and are interested in working with industry leading experts, an opportunity exists to join our dynamic and growing team in <b>Winnipeg, MB<\u002Fb>, one of Canada’s most culturally diverse cities, as a <b>Water and Wastewater Designer\u002FEngineer<\u002Fb>. Here you will support the delivery of projects and programs for our clients and have a hand in transforming tomorrow.<\u002Fp> \n <p>You will have the chance to work on exciting and engaging water and wastewater infrastructure and conveyance projects, where you’ll will use your knowledge to collaborate with our teams in a safe and efficient delivery – from start to finish. You’ll work with alongside and learn from experienced technical subject matter experts to support municipal and industrial project planning, modeling, and design based on established standards and software. <\u002Fp>\n <p>You will also gain experience working directly with contractors by assisting with construction administration services and field engineering services during construction from shop drawing reviews to site inspections to commissioning. You will participate in the development of water industry related engineering proposals, studies, reports, drawings, specifications, contract documents, proposals, and cost estimates alongside our team. <\u002Fp>\n <p><i>You’ll be working mainly from home (unless you prefer coming into the office), with the expectation to travel for client \u002Fsite meetings and occasional team meetings.<\u002Fi><br> <\u002Fp>\n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <ul> \n  <li>Bachelor’s degree in a related discipline (e.g. Chemical, Environmental, Biosystems, Mechanical, or Civil associated with water and mechanical wastewater treatment, wastewater collection, and water distribution systems<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Demonstrated ability to work independently under supervision of a professional engineer<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Keen attention to detail, and strong verbal and written communication skills, data analysis skills, technical problem-solving ability, and organizational skills transit<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Registration as an engineering intern or professional engineer in one of the Canadian provinces, or eligibility to be licensed\u002Fregistered as an engineering intern or professional engineer in the Province of Manitoba within 6-12 months<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Based in Winnipeg, Manitoba (or able to relocate to Winnipeg within 2 months)<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><i>Our People &amp; Places Solutions business – reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomizes the \"why\" of what we do – the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole. From facilities delivering life-saving therapies and ensuring clean water to enabling the connection of people through all modes of transportation and providing access to technology – we're integrating a multitude of these solution elements to build the smart environments of tomorrow.<\u002Fi><br> <br> <i>Start your Jacobs career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <br> \n <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> What we do is more than construction; we play a part in moving a vision from concept to reality. We work every day to create the spaces people live in and the infrastructure to improve their lives. If you want to join a company where you can have tangible impact, join our team in Toronto as a Submittals Lead – Transit \u002F Rail.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Under the direction of the Senior Project Manager and\u002For Technical Director and with minimal supervision you’ll be responsible for the management and coordination of project submittals. The successful candidate must have thorough knowledge and understand the objectives in contract administration systems (e.g., Unifier, CM14, ProjectWise) and related regulatory and\u002For industry requirements and practices with progressive experience ideally within major transit infrastructure projects. The position also provides support to coordinating stakeholders and technical design consultant requests.<\u002Fp> \n <p>This position performs in a fast-paced high energy team environment, supporting and assisting the Project Team through all project delivery phases for a large regional commuter transit project. The main phases of the project include, Preliminary Design, Detail design, Procurement and Construction contract administration.<\u002Fp> \n <p>If you're up for the challenge, we've been looking for someone just like you. Join our team and help us deliver successful projects.<br> <\u002Fp>\n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <ul>\n  <li><br> Reporting to the Senior Project Manager and\u002For Technical Director the position is responsible for the management of the project submittals process<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Supports Technical Director, Senior Project Manager and the project team as required<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Highly organized and ability to process and efficiently manage numerous submittals effectively and positively influence Client and Stakeholder team members.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Reviews and responds to project and program correspondence with excellent written and presentation skills.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Able to interact with senior clients and articulate complex concepts in a clear and concise manner.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Coordinates with document control team across all submittal related activities.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Able to lead and oversee junior members of the submittals management team.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Attendance at multiple, different, technical and commercial project working groups.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Verify information received from various sources in support of stakeholder requirements, design and construction submissions, studies, meeting minutes, action logs, dashboards, registers etc. are;<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> o collated,\n <br> o Track submittals to completion accordance with the timescale requirements,\n <br> o Maintain documentation of activities\n <br> o Reviewed for technical soundness\u002Fcompliance with requirement, conflicting requirements and or comments,\n <br> o Organized and kept up to date,\n <br> o Coordinated between all Stakeholder and project team\n <br> \n <ul>\n  <li>Process submittals from Client and Stakeholder teams including but not limited to the Technical Advisor (TA) and Project Co.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Interfaces with TA and Stakeholder teams on submittals issues to drive positive outcomes.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Resolves submittals and related issues providing recommendations to the project team where required.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Coordinate project team responses for technical memos etc.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Positive influencing skills and building excellent relationships.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Analyze and mitigate risk of delayed submittals and the impact on the project schedule.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Prepare summary reports for Executive Management.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>May be required to support on various project management activities.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <p>You’ll also need:<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>BS or MS Sound understanding of project management principles is highly desirable.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Understanding of design and construction ideally including transit infrastructure e.g., stations and their associated facilities, tunnels, and systems is an asset.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Knowledge of field activities such as Geotechnical, Topographic Survey and SUE (Subsurface Utility Engineering) investigations is an asset.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Sound understanding and practical experience of contract administration and document management software, CM14 and Aconex are desired<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Minimum 3 years’ experience in construction and major project environment<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Minimum 3 years’ working as a Project Coordinator, Submittals Coordinator or equivalent role<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Knowledge of transit engineering, operations, and maintenance is desirable<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Experience of engineering design management and review would be an asset<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Highly proficient with Microsoft Suite with a strong emphasis on Excel, and PowerPoint. <p><i>Our People &amp; Places Solutions business – reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomizes the \"why\" of what we do – the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole. From facilities delivering life-saving therapies and ensuring clean water to enabling the connection of people through all modes of transportation and providing access to technology – we're integrating a multitude of these solution elements to build the smart environments of tomorrow.<\u002Fi><br> <br> <i>Start your Jacobs career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <br> \n <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> At Jacobs, we’re partnering across the globe to create the best project outcomes by maximizing the design, digital technology, and support capabilities of our Global Integrated Delivery (GID) teammates. By joining, Jacobs, you’ll commit to supporting and engaging with these teams, as we work to build a company like no other.<\u002Fp> \n <p>When it comes to environmental consulting, we’re focused on the greatest challenges facing societies and the planet, including Indigenous reconciliation and climate change. We are looking for a Principle Archaeologist to lead our Archaeology Practice, and support our Indigenous Relations and Reconciliation Program for clients in Western Canada.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Based out of Burnaby, BC (this can be a remote position), you’ll have the opportunity to perform both field and office work and engage with our team’s recognized experts in characterizing, evaluating, and minimizing proposed projects’ effects on natural resources. Our projects include siting, permitting, construction, and maintenance projects. Your work will include desktop-based assessments, archaeological impact surveys and subcontractor management, community and Indigenous engagement programs, technical report writing (e.g., environmental assessments), and collaboration with other environmental professionals. You will have the opportunity to work on environmental compliance, permitting and impact assessment, and mitigation planning projects. You’ll be challenged as you support multiple projects across sectors (energy, mining, etc.). <\u002Fp>\n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <ul> \n  <li>Master’s degree in Anthropology or Archaeology<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience in technical report writing for Federal and Provincial Environmental Assessments<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience in archaeological impact assessments and Indigenous Engagement<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Permit Holder status in one or more Western Provinces: British Columbia, Alberta, Saskatchewan or Manitoba. Permit holder status in British Columbia is preferred but not required<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience completing all aspects of archaeological\u002Fheritage impact assessments<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience performing desktop surveys to determine need for permits and potential of archaeological\u002Fheritage resources across Western Canada<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience engaging with Indigenous groups and collaborating with representatives and community members to resolve complex and often contentious issues<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Proven ability to collaborate with Indigenous groups to identify opportunities to support capacity building<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Document and database management, including records of contact, meeting transcripts and site-specific data<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience interacting with clients, and provincial and federal regulators to coordinate information required for project compliance and approvals<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to travel and work in the field in remote locations, sometimes in inclement weather<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Valid BC or Alberta Class 5 Driver’s License or equivalent<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p>Ideally, you will also have:<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Field Director Status in British Columbia in one or more Culture Regions<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Knowledge of British Columbia archaeology, Canadian Indigenous history and Treaties, reporting and regulatory requirements<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Willingness to support other environmental disciplines as needed<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <i>At Jacobs, we’re challenging today to reinvent tomorrow by solving the world’s most critical problems for thriving cities, resilient environments, mission-critical outcomes, operational advancement, scientific discovery and cutting-edge manufacturing, turning abstract ideas into realities that transform the world for good. With $13 billion in revenue and a talent force of more than 55,000, Jacobs provides a full spectrum of professional services including consulting, technical, scientific and project delivery for the government and private <p><i>Our People &amp; Places Solutions business – reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomizes the \"why\" of what we do – the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole. From facilities delivering life-saving therapies and ensuring clean water to enabling the connection of people through all modes of transportation and providing access to technology – we're integrating a multitude of these solution elements to build the smart environments of tomorrow.<\u002Fi><br> <br> <i>Start your Jacobs career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <br> \n <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> At Jacobs, we’re partnering across the globe to create the best project outcomes by maximizing the design, digital technology, and support capabilities of our Global Integrated Delivery (GID) teammates. By joining Jacobs, you’ll commit to supporting and engaging with these teams, as we work to build a company like no other.<\u002Fp> \n <p>When it comes to environmental consulting, we’re focused on cleaning up our communities today to improve our tomorrow. As a Senior Environmental Data Management (EDM) Specialist you will have the responsibility of administering and coordinating the team of EDM and GIS staff, as well as performing EDM and GIS work. The work will involve the development and implementation of data management solution services for industrial clients. You will support multi-discipline teams of client and consulting staff in developing enterprise environmental information solutions.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Based out of one of our Canadian offices, you’ll be a key member of our EDM team, you’ll design, architect, and deliver complex technical solutions and be passionate about applying cutting edge technology. During your time with us, you will leverage your environmental data understanding and background, database, automation, and visualization skills while collaborating with experts in various disciplines to apply these technologies on a variety of projects. You’ll also be coordinating workload and tool development and implementation with Jacobs teams globally (such as in US, Canada, Europe, and Asia Pacific region). This position requires a self-motivated individual with the ability to balance work on multiple tasks, communication skills (written and verbal), organizational skills, and the ability to manage, mentor and grow teams within EDM. Development of data management best practices. Bring your expertise in environmental science and desire to conserve our natural resources, and we’ll empower you to deliver the boldest solutions for our clients.<\u002Fp> \n <p>#ges22<\u002Fp>\n As an Intermediate Planner, you’ll have the opportunity to support a multidisciplinary team in coordinating infrastructure development projects through the permitting and approvals process. This is a full-time position which is primarily office work. Bring your enthusiasm for learning and desire to conserve our natural resources, and we’ll help you grow! <\u002Fp>\n <p>At Jacobs, we’re partnering across the globe to create the best project outcomes by maximizing the design, digital technology, and support capabilities of our Global Integrated Delivery (GID) teammates. <p><i>Our People &amp; Places Solutions business – reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomizes the \"why\" of what we do – the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole. From facilities delivering life-saving therapies and ensuring clean water to enabling the connection of people through all modes of transportation and providing access to technology – we're integrating a multitude of these solution elements to build the smart environments of tomorrow.<\u002Fi><br> <br> <i>Start your Jacobs career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <br> \n <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> At Jacobs, we’re partnering across the globe to create the best project outcomes by maximizing the design, digital technology, and support capabilities of our Global Integrated Delivery (GID) teammates. By joining Jacobs, you’ll commit to supporting and engaging with these teams, as we work to build a company like no other.<\u002Fp> \n <p>When it comes to environmental consulting, we’re helping our clients secure our world’s natural resources. As a Senior Aquatic Biologist, you will provide technical leadership and guidance on the aquatic biology and water resource permitting components of our challenging natural resource projects, as well as coordination and support to our team of biologists.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Based throughout western Canada, this will be a full-time, mostly office-based role. You’ll have the opportunity to work as part of multi-disciplinary project teams guiding aquatic environmental planning and permitting efforts for government and privately-owned infrastructure projects. You will provide technical direction for the duration of these projects, throughout the design, construction, and operations phases. On projects, you will have the opportunity to lead the implementation of the work including the development of methodology, review of data collection efforts, technical reports, and regulatory applications and liaison. In this position you will establish and maintain relationships with clients, regulators and sub-contractors. This is a science-based role, and the successful candidate will have a reputation in the industry as a technical expert, and a demonstrated ability to defend the technical rigor of the work completed. Bring your expertise in environmental science and desire to conserve our natural resources, and we’ll empower you to deliver the boldest solutions for our clients.<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <ul>\n  <li><br> B.Sc. or M.Sc degree in fish or aquatic-related studies with relevant experience conducting and managing aquatic studies (such as fish and fish habitat assessments, water quality monitoring, fish sampling, etc.).<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>A minimum 12 years of experience (preferred 15+ years’ experience) as a Fish\u002FAquatic Biologist in the natural resources sector in western Canada, preferably in a consulting environment.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>Previous experience overseeing aquatics field work, directing and\u002For managing aquatic crews in remote settings from the office.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>Excellent technical writing skills and experience providing technical review and edits as needed.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>Relevant oil and gas and regulatory experience.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>Hold or be eligible for Professional Designation under the BC College of Applied Biology and the Alberta Society of Professional Biologists.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>Previous consulting experience.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>In depth knowledge and experience with the Federal Fisheries Act and other relevant provincial and federal environmental legislation in western Canada and how it applies to natural resource projects.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>Experience liaising with regulators and providing strategic regulatory advice to clients and internal teams during all stages of the project life cycle.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>Experience in client liaison and business development.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>Must have driver’s license and clean driver’s abstract.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <p>Ideally, You’ll Also Have:<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Experience working with a diverse range of industrial clients, including oil and gas, mining, transportation,
