<p><i>Our People &amp; Places Solutions business – reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomizes the \"why\" of what we do – the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole. From facilities delivering life-saving therapies and ensuring clean water to enabling the connection of people through all modes of transportation and providing access to technology – we're integrating a multitude of these solution elements to build the smart environments of tomorrow.<\u002Fi><br> <br> <i>Start your Jacobs career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <br> \n <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> We challenge what is currently accepted, so we can shape innovative and lasting solutions for tomorrow. If you’re interested in a long and rewarding career working with the #1 ranked most admired engineering \u002F construction company in the world, and the industry’s best and most innovative engineers, then Jacobs is where you belong. We are looking for a driven and curious Planning \u002F Scheduling Manager in Toronto, to support a large multi-billion-dollar Transit \u002F Rail Program.<\u002Fp> \n <p>As a key member of our Transit \u002F Rail Program Management team, you’ll bring gravitas, respect, and experience to the program scheduling function, including both the client team and the contractors. In this Senior position, you’ll be able to facilitate workshops, chair meetings, allocate actions and achieve timely results. You’ll also provide vision, leadership, direction, and example to the program scheduling team to ensure best practice is always maintained, resources are effectively utilized between projects, always seeking to drive improvements.<br> <br> Join us and we will assist in continuing the development of your skills and exploring all that you can do across our global company, with opportunities to share your knowledge along the way.<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Ensure that schedulers within the team are performing to the best of their capability, are satisfying the requirements of the project delivery teams, are adding value to the client and are maintaining the integrity of the Integrated Master Schedule.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>In conjunction with the Head of PMO, provide guidance and training to schedulers and manage the relationship between the scheduling team and schedule risk management for projects and program where required, support their career aspirations and deal with underperformance issues.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Demonstrate collaboration skills by overcoming resistance from challenging parties and individuals.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Develop and maintain cooperative work relationships with the internal program and project team members and the external entities such as clients, stakeholders, technical advisors, and contractors.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Be able to effectively communicate complex scheduling, technical and interface issues, and information to varied audiences including clients, departmental management, client senior management, engineering, construction integration, and project teams.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Provide strategic leadership within the program team to ensure that the project schedules and in particular the Integrated Master Schedule are fully understood within their limits, such that the program and project teams can leverage the scheduling team to best advantage.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Ensure that the impact to other parties of slippages to completion dates are fully analyzed through communication with the central scheduling team.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Develop strong relationships with program senior management and the central scheduling team through all communications channels including face to face contact, and effectively manage situations where conflict could arise.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Ensure that the integrity and consistency of the Integrated Master Schedule is maintained without exceptions.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Work in Client office environment and able to perform under matrix reporting organization<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Develop a full understanding of project scope, project requirements and contractual documents.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Understand construction methodology, track access requirements and constraints, interfaces and third party obligations.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Implement best practice schedule and integration techniques, reflecting what are practiced on other large infrastructure programs world-wide.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Keep up to date with emerging business and industry trends and the implications of these trends for scheduling.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Develop and maintain whole lifecycle project schedules which reflect the strategy of the Project Delivery Team with clearly defined critical paths, interfaces and external dependencies<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Develop relationships with responsible managers and Directors, and provide motivation for them to fully utilize the schedule and to use it to support their decision making.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Understand and interpret contractor proposals; review contractor schedules based on contracts scheduling requirements and provide recommendations to the project team on acceptance or rejection.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Ensure that baseline contractor schedules accepted do not un-necessarily expose the client to future claims and support the client with forensic analysis of contractor schedules in the event of claim submissions.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Establish and maintain baseline schedules.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Update schedules with actual progress and forecast remaining durations, key milestone dates and completion and handover dates.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Support schedule risk analysis which is used to forecast and manage time contingencies.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Prepare delay analysis, critical path analysis and other performance reports and present them to the project delivery team in their regular progress meetings.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Prepare and issue schedule analysis narratives including recommendations for corrective actions that are used by project delivery teams to manage the work.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Analyze schedule progress and performance, identify potential risks, issues and problem areas and facilitate their resolution.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Develop, implement, and monitor earned value systems that accurately measure progress and performance.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Apply practical field experience with scheduling knowledge to identify challenges to the project schedule and suggest mitigation plans.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Develop and maintain the overall Integrated Schedule architecture for the wider program including codes, calendars, key milestones and interface milestones. Ensure that central scheduling team requirements regarding schedule standards, consistency and quality are rigorously adhered to.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <div>\n  <br> Accountability:\n  <br> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Accountable to client or Jacobs project delivery team senior management.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Provide international best in class scheduling standards to ensure that both client and Jacobs meet their scheduling goals.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n <\u002Fdiv> \n <div>\n  Relationships:\n  <br> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Work with the wider Jacobs scheduling team, functionally reporting to the Head of Scheduling to maintain the integrity of the Integrated Master<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n <\u002Fdiv> \n <div>\n  Schedule.\n  <br> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Develop and maintain meaningful relationships with other project team leads including cost, engineering, procurement, construction, project accounting, and so forth.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Develop and maintain meaningful relationships with applicable external entities such as clients, partners, and subcontractors.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n <\u002Fdiv> \n <div>\n  Project Delivery Knowledge:\n  <br> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Strong construction and rail experience<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Strong analytical thinking and skills.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Solid knowledge and experience with earned value analysis<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Prefer Canadian work experience and understanding of various types of Canadian specific construction contracts, ie.) AFP \u002F P3, DB or DBB projects<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Prefer demonstrated experience and knowledge of very large, complex, multi-disciplinary rail and construction programs<\u002Fli>\n   <li>An advantage to have at least some experience working for a contractor<\u002Fli>\n   <li>An advantage to have worked for a major consultancy<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n <\u002Fdiv> \n <div>\n team<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Strong sense of taking initiative and ownership of work with a minimum of supervision<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Maintain continuous improvement and ensure that Jacobs deliver a best in class service to the client.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n <\u002Fdiv> \n <div>\n  Communications:\n  <br> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Be able to facilitate workshops and chair meetings<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Possess As a wetland specialist, you will too. Pave the way for your career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow. You'll impact the world around you by helping us solve real-life challenges.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Based out of your home office in Calgary or Edmonton, you’ll work as part of our wetlands team to contribute to the environmental planning and permitting efforts of privately-owned infrastructure projects. You will have the opportunity to support projects through field data collection efforts, and assisting with the development of technical reports, and regulatory applications. This position can either be fulltime or a flex contract position (7-month contract). This position could have up to 75% of travel for fieldwork and 25% office work. Potential for contract extension based on performance and anticipated workload. Bring your enthusiasm for learning and desire to conserve our natural resources, and we’ll help you grow!<\u002Fp> \n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <ul> \n  <li>B.Sc. or M.Sc. in biology, related to ecology, hydrology, wetlands, botany, or equivalent demonstrated experience<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Hold or be eligible for P.Biol. designation for Alberta. <p><i>Our People &amp; Places Solutions business – reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomizes the \"why\" of what we do – the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole. From facilities delivering life-saving therapies and ensuring clean water to enabling the connection of people through all modes of transportation and providing access to technology – we're integrating a multitude of these solution elements to build the smart environments of tomorrow.<\u002Fi><br> <br> <i>Start your Jacobs career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <br> \n <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> At Jacobs, we’re partnering across the globe to create the best project outcomes by maximizing the design, digital technology, and support capabilities of our Global Integrated Delivery (GID) teammates. By joining, Jacobs, you’ll commit to supporting and engaging with these teams, as we work to build a company like no other.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Jacobs is currently looking to hire an entry to intermediate Environmental Planner based out of the western Canadian offices (Calgary, Vancouver or Edmonton) to join our dynamic team. This position provides technical leadership and guidance to our multi-disciplinary (environment practitioners) teams during the design, construction and operations of infrastructure projects in western Canada relative to regulatory requirements, environmental due diligence and planning.<\u002Fp> \n <p>The successful candidate will join our Global Environmental Solutions group and will work as part of multi-disciplinary project teams to oversee the environmental permitting and planning efforts of government and privately owned infrastructure projects. You’ll support environmental planning and permitting work with a multi-disciplinary team throughout the life cycle of a project. Oversee the preparation of environmental assessments, permit and regulatory filings, and environmental management plans. Coordinate and provide technical writing support for environmental assessments for projects and programs. Includes coordinating the completion of subject specific environmental studies. Supporting engagement efforts with Indigenous communities, stakeholders and regulatory agencies. Establish and maintain relationships with members of the public, government and non-government communities, associations, tenure holders and Indigenous communities. In a collaborative manner, develop and expand our client portfolio, including support for Business Development and proposal efforts. Develop staff through on-the-job mentorship.<\u002Fp> \n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>B.Sc. (required) or M.Sc. (preferred) in a Natural Resources related field (biology, ecology, forestry, or geography)<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Related experience in the natural resources sector in Canada, preferably in BC and in a consulting environment.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Familiarity with environmental acts, such as the Canadian Environmental Assessment Act, National Energy Board Act, Environmental Protection and Enhancement Act, and the Public Lands Act is considered an asset.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience seeing major projects from planning through construction considered an asset.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Strong technical writing skills is required. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Experience working on Provincially regulated projects in Alberta and British Columbia, including a strong understanding of permitting energy development projects regulated by the Alberta Energy Regulator, Alberta Environment and Parks, BC Oil and Gas Commission, and BC Environmental Assessment Office. Experience working on federally regulated energy projects in Western Canada, including experience working on projects regulated by the National Energy Board.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Construction based environmental monitoring experience is an asset.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p>Ideally, You’ll Also Have:<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Requires a high level of initiative and problem-solving.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Team player with strong interpersonal and communication skills with proficiency in written and spoken English to communicate effectively with internal and external stakeholders and prepare technical reports.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to work on multiple projects with strong organizational and time management skills.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Demonstrated ability to work under minimal supervision.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <i>At Jacobs, we’re challenging today to reinvent tomorrow by solving the world’s most critical problems for thriving cities, resilient environments, mission-critical outcomes, operational advancement, scientific discovery and cutting-edge manufacturing, turning abstract ideas into realities that transform the world for good. With $13 billion in revenue and a talent force of more than 55,000, Jacobs provides a full spectrum of professional services including consulting, technical, scientific and project delivery for the government and private <p><i>Our People &amp; Places Solutions business – reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomizes the \"why\" of what we do – the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole. From facilities delivering life-saving therapies and ensuring clean water to enabling the connection of people through all modes of transportation and providing access to technology – we're integrating a multitude of these solution elements to build the smart environments of tomorrow.<\u002Fi><br> <br> <i>Start your Jacobs career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <br> \n <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> Here is another chance to support the delivery of projects and programs for clients across Canada by joining a dynamic and growing team in Winnipeg, one of Canada’s most culturally diverse cities. This is an opportunity to continue building your technical and project management skills by working in a leading role on water and wastewater treatment and conveyance projects. You will plan, direct, and monitor projects and resources to deliver projects with varying scope and technical complexity from the concept to handover. If you have been searching for a career changing opportunity and are interested in working with industry leading experts, you’ll find it at Jacobs. <\u002Fp>\n <p>As a Senior Technical Leader, you will be a key member of our team of engineers and project managers in a role to guide projects to successful delivery and grow our business across the Prairies. You will use your technical expertise to guide project teams and provide innovative solutions for our clients most difficult problems. You will develop execution plans for projects, including scope, fee, schedule, quality, health and safety, risk management, and change management plans. You will also negotiate and manage sub-agreements; track, control and report on project performance; and ensure timely invoicing and cash collection. Simultaneously, you will provide technical guidance for deliverables, and develop, mentor and empower the project team while being a strong safety proponent \u002Fleader for our safety policies and our culture of caring. <\u002Fp>\n <p>Furthermore, with your unflinching focus on our clients’ satisfaction, you will maintain regular and effective communication with clients. You will actively support the business development and client service team in developing and expanding opportunities with existing and new clients, and you will have the opportunity to provide input into growth and delivery strategy within the geography.<\u002Fp> \n <p>At Jacobs, we provide the opportunity to design your career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow. <p><i>Our People &amp; Places Solutions business – reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomizes the \"why\" of what we do – the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole. From facilities delivering life-saving therapies and ensuring clean water to enabling the connection of people through all modes of transportation and providing access to technology – we're integrating a multitude of these solution elements to build the smart environments of tomorrow.<\u002Fi><br> <br> <i>Start your Jacobs career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <br> \n <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> The Buildings &amp; Infrastructure Line of Business is a global network of employees, which serves both the private and public sector. Our employees work to shape the communities we live in by creating world-class projects that transform the future development patterns of those communities. We provide our clients award-winning planning, engineering, architectural and interior design, construction and program management, and design-build project delivery. The Jacobs business model allows us to successfully service our clients, leverage our integrated services, and provide our employees with growth opportunities while delivering global solutions to our client’s local programs.<\u002Fp> \n <p>We consistently receive high rankings from Engineering News-Record (ENR) in many classifications, including the categories of Top Design Firms, Top Contractors, Top Green Buildings Design Firms, and Top Transportation Companies.<\u002Fp> \n <p>We are looking for a <b>Senior Structural Engineer<\u002Fb> in our <b>Burnaby, BC<\u002Fb> office that has experience in leading the structural discipline on large water infrastructure projects, including water\u002Fwastewater treatment plants, pumping stations, commercial and industrial facilities.<\u002Fp> \n <p>In this role, you'll be involved in leading and executing all aspects of structural design. You will develop designs from a conceptual level through to a detailed design using advanced structural modelling supported by hand calculations and approximations. You are knowledgeable of local code requirements so that you can develop structural design criteria such as gravity, wind and seismic loads. If you're up for the challenge, we've been looking for someone just like you. Join our team and help us lay the foundation for human progress!<\u002Fp> \n <p>In this role, you will:<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Lead and perform design calculations for structures made of steel, concrete and masonry.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Possess a thorough knowledge of statics, strength of materials, finite element modeling, and building\u002Fstructure systems.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Serve as a technical leader and mentor.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Provide design and design management deliverables to other Project Managers<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Monitor project design execution and progress, staff resource, schedule, scope, and budget.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Develop client relationships in key markets and help to identify upcoming opportunities.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Lead and develop proposals.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Possess a thorough knowledge of multiple subject areas and other design disciplines and understands how own discipline integrates with and impacts other disciplines.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <ul> \n  <li>BSc. or M.Sc. in Structural Engineering or related field<\u002Fli> \n  <li>P.Eng. designation in BC<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Minimum 12 years of structural design experience<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Minimum 5 years experience working on municipal water \u002Fwastewater type of projects<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience with structural analysis software (i.e., STAAD, RAM, SAP2000, Visual Analysis, etc)<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience with seismic design, specific to British Columbia preferred<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Excellent communication skills and the ability to work with individuals at all levels of the organization<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p>The ideal candidate will possess the following skills and experience:<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Structural Eng. Designation preferred<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p>Jacobs is an equal opportunity employer.<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <br> \n <i>At Jacobs, we’re challenging today to reinvent tomorrow by solving the world’s most critical problems for thriving cities, resilient environments, mission-critical outcomes, operational advancement, scientific discovery and cutting-edge manufacturing, turning abstract ideas into realities that transform the world for good. <p><i>Our People &amp; Places Solutions business – reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomizes the \"why\" of what we do – the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole. From facilities delivering life-saving therapies and ensuring clean water to enabling the connection of people through all modes of transportation and providing access to technology – we're integrating a multitude of these solution elements to build the smart environments of tomorrow.<\u002Fi><br> <br> <i>Start your Jacobs career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <br> \n <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> At Jacobs, we’re partnering across the globe to create the best project outcomes by maximizing the design, digital technology, and support capabilities of our Global Integrated Delivery (GID) teammates. By joining Jacobs, you’ll commit to supporting and engaging with these teams, as we work to build a company like no other.<\u002Fp> \n <p>When it comes to environmental consulting, we’re helping our clients secure our world’s natural resources. As a Mid-Career Level Wildlife Biologist, you will provide technical leadership and guidance on the wildlife biology components of our challenging natural resource projects, as well as coordination and support to our team of biologists.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Based in western Canada (British Columbia: Burnaby, Victoria, or various northern locations), this will be a full-time, mostly office-based role. You’ll have the opportunity to work as part of multi-disciplinary project teams guiding wildlife environmental planning and permitting efforts for government and privately-owned infrastructure projects. You will provide technical direction for the duration of these projects, throughout the design, construction, and operations phases. On projects, you will have the opportunity to lead the implementation of the work including the development of methodology, review of data collection efforts, technical reports, and regulatory applications and liaison. In this position you will establish and maintain relationships with clients, regulators and sub-contractors. This is a science-based role, and the successful candidate will have a reputation in the industry as a technical expert, and a demonstrated ability to defend the technical rigor of the work completed. Bring your expertise in environmental science and desire to conserve our natural resources, and we’ll empower you to deliver the boldest solutions for our clients.<\u002Fp> \n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <ul>\n  <li><br> B.Sc., M.Sc. or equivalent in biophysical sciences with relevant experience conducting and managing field studies for wildlife (such as wildlife inventories and habitat assessments, and mitigation and monitoring efforts).<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>A minimum 10 years of experience as a Biologist in the natural resources sector in Western Canada<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>Experience with overseeing biophysical field work, technical reporting and permitting applications, and directing field crews in remote settings and office-based staff<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>Excellent technical writing skills and experience providing technical reviews<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>Experience in environmental consulting<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>Hold Professional Designation under either the BC College of Applied Biology or Alberta Society of Professional Biologists<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>In-depth knowledge and experience with the relevant provincial and federal environmental legislation in Western Canada and how it applies to capital projects, including oil and gas regulatory processes and requirements.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>Experience liaising with regulators and providing strategic regulatory advice to clients and internal teams during all stages of a project life cycle<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>Business development experience and interest<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>Driver’s license and clean driver’s abstract<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>Eligibility to fly on domestic flights as per current Federal Regulations<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <p>Ideally, You’ll Also Have:<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Experience working with a diverse range of industrial clients beyond oil and gas, including mining, transportation, energy transmission and renewable energy<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>Cross-discipline experience with fish and fish habitat assessments, vegetation\u002Fecosystem or wetland assessments is preferred<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>Experience with and interest in staff supervision and mentoring<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <br> \n <i>At Jacobs, we’re challenging today to reinvent tomorrow by solving the world’s most critical problems for thriving cities, resilient environments, mission-critical outcomes, operational advancement, scientific discovery and cutting-edge manufacturing, turning abstract ideas into realities that transform the world for good. With $13 billion in revenue and a talent force of more than 55,000, Jacobs provides a full spectrum of professional services including consulting, technical, scientific and project delivery for the government and private By joining Jacobs, you'll commit to supporting and engaging with these teams as we work to build a company like no other. <\u002Fp>\n <p>Whether it's for treating water, hosting businesses, or connecting our world, solutions are continuously being implemented. What we do is more than construction; we play a part in moving a vision from concept to reality. We work every day to create the spaces people live in and the infrastructure to improve their lives. If you want to join a company where you can have a tangible impact, join us as a <b>Senior Conveyance Contract Administrator<\u002Fb> in our <b>Toronto, ON<\u002Fb> office. <\u002Fp>\n <p>You will have the chance to work on exciting and engaging water and wastewater infrastructure and conveyance projects for our Municipal Clients, where you will utilize your expertise to collaborate with our teams in a safe and efficient delivery – from start to finish. <\u002Fp>\n <p>As a <b>Senior Conveyance Contract Administrator<\u002Fb>, you will work as an Owner's representative in the field on various types of infrastructure and conveyance projects, leading other members of the site inspection and support team. You will coordinate and communicate with all stakeholders on a project, including client project manager, municipalities, design team, and third parties: regulatory bodies, municipal and federal agencies, testing agencies and laboratories, as well as contractors. <\u002Fp>\n <p>You will ensure construction is in accordance with contract drawings and specifications; manage records of construction activities; prepare reports; keep logs; prepare change orders and payment certificates, keep photo records, etc. You will coordinate and facilitate with engineering design team review of shop drawing; requests for information, site instructions and assist in resolving design\u002Fconstruction issues in the field. You will evaluate, select, and apply the company's and client's standards for construction inspections and administration. <\u002Fp>\n <p>If you're up for the challenge, we've been looking for someone just like you. Join our team and help us deliver successful projects. <\u002Fp>\n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <p><b><br> You must have: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>Engineering and heavy construction experience in municipal infrastructure and conveyance projects<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Proven track record of delivering heavy construction projects on time and within budget<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Demonstrated ability to direct and\u002For supervise project teams <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Foresight and balanced judgement in anticipating and solving problems during construction. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Worked as owner's representative in managing construction contracts including; acting as the primary point of contract, preparing payments, change orders, request for information, schedule review and oversight, time extensions, and certificates of completion.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Preparation and distribution of weekly reports<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Participate and run effective daily\u002Fweekly CM meetings<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Participate in Project Workshops, Client and Construction meetings<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Valid driver's license and a car to drive to the sites <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Ability to work at heights <\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>Here's what You'll Need: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>A current licence in good standing with a public body within the province of Ontario, such as Professional Engineers of Ontario (P.Eng.) (preferred) or The Ontario Association of Certified Engineering Technicians and Technologists - Certified Engineering Technologist (C.E.T.)<\u002Fli> \n  <li>University degree or Engineering technology diploma or demonstrated experience <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Extensive experience with linear conveyance construction administration experience is required. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Municipal client project experience is required<\u002Fli> \n  <li>High capital value project or program experience preferred<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to effectively communicate with clients and contractors <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Ability to tolerate outdoor weather conditions in summer and winter. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Experience working in the GTA is strongly preferred <\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p>You are Jacobs' face to the client and public during construction, and as such, you have demonstrated strengths in respectful communication, problem solving, and a love for working with people and getting things done. You are resourceful, independent and willing to go the extra mile to gain satisfaction in implementing an excellent project. <\u002Fp>\n <p>At Jacobs, we're challenging today to reinvent tomorrow by solving the world's most critical problems for thriving cities, resilient environments, mission-critical outcomes, operational advancement, scientific discovery and cutting-edge manufacturing, turning abstract ideas into realities that transform the world for good. <p><i>Our People &amp; Places Solutions business – reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomizes the \"why\" of what we do – the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole. From facilities delivering life-saving therapies and ensuring clean water to enabling the connection of people through all modes of transportation and providing access to technology – we're integrating a multitude of these solution elements to build the smart environments of tomorrow.<\u002Fi><br> <br> <i>Start your Jacobs career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <br> \n <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> Our People &amp; Places Solutions business – reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomizes the \"why\" of what we do – the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole. From facilities delivering life-saving therapies and ensuring clean water to enabling the connection of people through all modes of transportation and providing access to technology – we're integrating a multitude of these solution elements to build the smart environments of tomorrow. <\u002Fp>\n <p>Start your Jacobs career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow. <\u002Fp>\n <p>Your Impact:<\u002Fp> \n <p>At Jacobs, we're partnering across the globe to create the best project outcomes by maximizing the design, digital technology, and support capabilities of our Global Integrated Delivery (GID) teammates. By joining Jacobs, you'll commit to supporting and engaging with these teams as we work to build a company like no other. <\u002Fp>\n <p>Whether it's for treating water, hosting businesses, or connecting our world, solutions are continuously being implemented. What we do is more than construction; we play a part in moving a vision from concept to reality. We work every day to create the spaces people live in and the infrastructure to improve their lives. If you want to join a company where you can have a tangible impact, join us as a <b>Senior Tunneling Contract Administrator<\u002Fb> in our <b>Toronto, ON<\u002Fb> office. <\u002Fp>\n <p>You will have the chance to work on exciting and engaging water and wastewater infrastructure and conveyance projects for our Municipal Clients, where you will utilize your expertise to collaborate with our teams in a safe and efficient delivery – from start to finish. <\u002Fp>\n <p>As a <b>Senior Tunneling Contract Administrator<\u002Fb>, you will work as an Owner's representative in the field, on various types of infrastructure and conveyance projects, leading other members of the site inspection and support team. You will coordinate and communicate with all stakeholders on a project, including: client project manager, municipalities, design team, and third parties: regulatory bodies, municipal and federal agencies; testing agencies and laboratories, as well as contractors. <\u002Fp>\n <p>You will ensure construction is in accordance with contract drawings and specifications; manage records of construction activities; prepare reports; keep logs; prepare change orders and payment certificates, keep photo records, etc. You will coordinate and facilitate with engineering design team review of shop drawing; requests for information, site instructions and assist in resolving design\u002Fconstruction issues in the field. You will evaluate, select, and apply company's and client's standards for construction inspections and administration. <\u002Fp>\n <p>If you're up for the challenge, we've been looking for someone just like you. Join our team and help us deliver successful projects. <\u002Fp>\n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <p><b><br> You must have: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>Engineering and heavy construction experience in municipal infrastructure and conveyance projects<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Proven track record of delivering heavy construction projects on time and within budget<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Demonstrated ability to direct and\u002For supervise project teams <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Foresight and balanced judgement in anticipating and solving problems during construction. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Worked as owner's representative in managing construction contracts including; acting as the primary point of contract, preparing payments, change orders, request for information, schedule review and oversight, time extensions, and certificates of completion.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Preparation and distribution of weekly reports<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Participate and run effective daily\u002Fweekly CM meetings<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Participate in Project Workshops, Client and Construction meetings<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Valid driver's license and a car to drive to the sites <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Ability to work at heights <\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>Here's what You'll Need: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>A current licence in good standing with a public body within the province of Ontario, such as Professional Engineers of Ontario (P.Eng.) (preferred) or The Ontario Association of Certified Engineering Technicians and Technologists - Certified Engineering Technologist (C.E.T.)<\u002Fli> \n  <li>University degree or Engineering technology diploma or demonstrated experience <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Extensive experience with linear conveyance construction administration experience is required<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Prior experience on multiple large tunneling projects is preferred<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Municipal client project experience is required<\u002Fli> \n  <li>High capital value project or program experience preferred<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to effectively communicate with clients and contractors <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Ability to tolerate outdoor weather conditions in summer and winter<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience working in the GTA is strongly preferred <\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p>You are Jacobs' face to the client and public during construction, and as such, you have demonstrated strengths in respectful communication, problem solving, and a love for working with people and getting things done. You are resourceful, independent and willing to go the extra mile to gain satisfaction in implementing an excellent project. <\u002Fp>\n <p>At Jacobs, we're challenging today to reinvent tomorrow by solving the world's most critical problems for thriving cities, resilient environments, mission-critical outcomes, operational advancement, scientific discovery and cutting-edge manufacturing, turning abstract ideas into realities that transform the world for good. With $13 billion in revenue and a talent force of more than 55,000, Jacobs provides a full spectrum of professional services, including consulting, technical, scientific and project delivery for the government and private sector.<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <br> \n <i>At Jacobs, we’re challenging today to reinvent tomorrow by solving the world’s most critical problems for thriving cities, resilient environments, mission-critical outcomes, operational advancement, scientific discovery and cutting-edge manufacturing, turning abstract ideas into realities that transform the world for good. As a wetland specialist, you will too. Pave the way for your career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow. You'll impact the world around you by helping us solve real-life challenges.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Based out of your home office in British Columbia, you’ll work as part of our wetlands team to contribute to the environmental planning and permitting efforts of privately-owned infrastructure projects. You will have the opportunity to support projects through field data collection efforts, and assisting with the development of technical reports, and regulatory applications. This position can either be fulltime or a flex contract position (7-month contract). This position could have up to 75% of travel for fieldwork and 25% office work. Potential for contract extension based on performance and anticipated workload. Bring your enthusiasm for learning and desire to conserve our natural resources, and we’ll help you grow!<\u002Fp> \n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <ul> \n  <li>B.Sc. or M.Sc. in biology, related to ecology, hydrology, wetlands, botany, or equivalent demonstrated experience<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Hold or be eligible for R.P.Bio. or other professional designation for British Columbia. <p><i>Our People &amp; Places Solutions business – reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomizes the \"why\" of what we do – the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole. From facilities delivering life-saving therapies and ensuring clean water to enabling the connection of people through all modes of transportation and providing access to technology – we're integrating a multitude of these solution elements to build the smart environments of tomorrow.<\u002Fi><br> <br> <i>Start your Jacobs career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <br> \n <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> At Jacobs, we challenge what is currently accepted, so we can shape innovative and lasting solutions for tomorrow. If you’re interested in a long term and rewarding career working with the #1 globally ranked water treatment engineering firm, and with the industry’s best and most innovative engineers, then Jacobs is where you belong.<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p>We have an exciting opportunity for a <b>Senior Process Mechanical Design Engineer \u002FDesign Manager <\u002Fb>position in our <b>Burnaby, British Columbia office<\u002Fb>. In this role you’ll have the opportunity to utilize your technical leadership and knowledge in process and mechanical engineering design of systems for municipal water and wastewater treatment facilities and pumping stations.<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p>As the Senior Process Mechanical Engineer\u002FDesign Manager, you’ll lead process and mechanical engineering teams in the design of large municipal water and wastewater treatment plants and pumping stations. You’ll provide technical leadership in the area of process mechanical engineering both locally and regionally and advocate the use of advance engineering and automation tools in the design. You’ll provide design coordination between multiple engineering disciplines and expert advice to internal and external clients, including performing process and equipment condition assessments at water and wastewater treatment facilities and pumping stations. You’ll be responsible for the projects engineering budget, as well as the project’s schedule and quality of deliverables.<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p>As a passionate design lead, you’ll leverage your people management skills to help your team members discover what drives them, nurturing their purpose and guiding them forward. Most importantly, you’ll take action to ensure the safety, health and well-being of your team and our planet.<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p>We are invested in you and your success. Our values stand on a foundation of safety, integrity, inclusion and diversity. We put people at the heart of our business and we truly believe that by supporting one another through our culture of caring, we all succeed. We value positive mental health and a sense of belonging for all employees. We aim to make inclusion and diversity core attributes of our identity, embedded in all our employment and business practices in all locations. We know that if we are inclusive, we’re more connected, and if we are diverse, we’re more creative.<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><br> As a Disability Confident employer, we will interview all disabled applicants who meet the minimum criteria for a vacancy. We welcome applications from candidates who are seeking flexible working and from those who may not meet all the listed requirements for a role.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Bring your curiosity, passion for innovation, and talent for multi-tasking in a fast-paced environment. We’ll help you grow, pursue and fulfill what inspires you – so we can make big impacts on the world, together.<\u002Fp> \n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <ul>\n  <li><br> Bachelor’s degree in Civil, Environmental, Mechanical or Chemical Engineering<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>Holds (or eligible for) a P.Eng. with Engineers and Geoscientist of British Columbia<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>At least 15 years’ experience in design, construction management and commissioning of systems for process-mechanical municipal facilities or similar type water and wastewater treatment facilities<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>Experience functioning as Design Manager for water and wastewater treatment plant design projects with demonstrated success leading interdisciplinary coordination, manage budgets and schedules and reporting to clients through effective written and verbal communication.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>Positive attitude, dependable, with the ability to work independently as well as part of a team to meet deadlines and provide a high quality of work and mentorship and development of staff<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>Experience with Design Build Project is an asset<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>Desire to grow personally as well as professionally with each new process \u002Fprocess mechanical engineering task<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <br> \n <i>At Jacobs, we’re challenging today to reinvent tomorrow by solving the world’s most critical problems for thriving cities, resilient environments, mission-critical outcomes, operational advancement, scientific discovery and cutting-edge manufacturing, turning abstract ideas into realities that transform the world for good. With $13 billion in revenue and a talent force of more than 55,000, Jacobs provides a full spectrum of professional services including consulting, technical, scientific and project delivery for the government and private our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole. Work from home option. Only attend client meetings and conduct public consultations in the Toronto and \u002For KWO area up to10% of the time.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Jacobs is ranked #1 in the world by ENR for Wastewater Treatment and Conveyance Design. We provide a full service offering to our clients from planning and design through construction. Working with a team of highly motivated engineers, scientists, and project managers, you’ll champion the delivery of high-quality projects that meet or exceed client expectations. You’ll also be a strong safety proponent \u002Fleader for our safety policies and our culture of caring.<\u002Fp> \n <p>You’ll oversee Environmental Assessments and associated master plan development focused on municipal water and wastewater treatment facilities. You’ll develop execution plans for projects, including scope, fee, schedule, quality, health and safety, risk management, and change management plans; you’ll negotiate and manage sub-agreements, track, control, and report on project performance, ensure of timely invoicing and cash collection, while also providing guidance related to environmental matters including supporting discussions, permit, and approvals with regulatory agencies. You’ll also provide advice related to environmental legislation, standards, guidelines, and policies within Ontario.<\u002Fp> \n <p>With your unflinching focus on our clients’ satisfaction, you’ll maintain regular and effective communication with clients. You’ll actively support the Business Development Manager and Client Service Managers in developing and expanding opportunities with existing and new clients. You’ll have the opportunity to provide input into growth and delivery strategy within the geography.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Join our team and apply your knowledge, skills, and experience to some of the most challenging and interesting projects and programs in the Canadian water and wastewater field.<\u002Fp> \n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <ul>\n  <li><br> Bachelor’s degree or higher in a project planning, scheduling, estimating, and budgeting, progress and performance monitoring and reporting<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Thorough understanding of environmental legislation, policies, standards and guidelines applicable to water and wastewater infrastructure projects in Ontario<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Demonstrated experience in preparation of environmental input to contract documentation including <p><i>Our People &amp; Places Solutions business – reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomizes the \"why\" of what we do – the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole. From facilities delivering life-saving therapies and ensuring clean water to enabling the connection of people through all modes of transportation and providing access to technology – we're integrating a multitude of these solution elements to build the smart environments of tomorrow.<\u002Fi><br> <br> <i>Start your Jacobs career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <br> \n <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> When it comes to environmental consulting, you’ll work for a company that strives to provide opportunities for employees to learn, grow and thrive. We’re focused on helping our clients protect our world’s natural resources. Jacobs is currently looking to hire a Senior Planner or Project Manager to join our dynamic team to provide technical support and guidance on construction permitting requirements to our multidisciplinary teams and clients during the design, construction, and operation of infrastructure projects. This is a leadership position in support of a major program.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Based in Western Canada and aligned with one of our offices in British Columbia or Alberta, you will be part of the Environmental Planning and Permitting practice and will work as part of multi-disciplinary project teams to oversee compliance with regulatory requirements for infrastructure projects. The successful candidate will also support the growth of the business by leading proposal efforts. A key aspect of the role will be providing on-the-job mentorship. Bring your enthusiasm for learning and desire to conserve our natural resources, and we’ll help you grow!<\u002Fp> \n <p>You will be guided in your Jacobs career by senior leaders. And, as you progress, your growth and increase in responsibility will be recognized and rewarded with commensurate changes in level and compensation. Jacobs supports work from home and flexible schedules. A consistent presence in one of our offices is not required.<\u002Fp> \n <p>At Jacobs, we’re partnering across the globe to create the best project outcomes by maximizing the design, digital technology, and support capabilities of our Global Integrated Delivery (GID) teammates. looking for a driven and curious Lead Planner \u002F Scheduler in Toronto to support various Transit and Rail projects.<\u002Fp> \n <p>As a leader on a large multi-billion-dollar Transit \u002F Rail Program, you’ll be responsible for Schedule review and analysis which includes:<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Analysis of Contractor’s schedule progress and performance, identify potential issues and problem areas, and provide reports to the project management team.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>Prepare and issue schedule analysis narratives including recommendations for corrective actions that are used by the project management team to manage the work.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>Undertake forensic schedule analysis and provide report to the project management team.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>Undertake what-if schedule analysis and present the results to the project management team.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>Clean up Contractor’s schedule or develop analysis-ready schedule that reflects Contractor’s schedule logic as preparation for quantitative schedule risk analysis.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>Undertake quantitative schedule risk analysis, interpret the output, and present the result to the project management team and\u002For other stakeholders.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>Understand and interpret contractual requirements and provide appropriate comments on Contractor’s schedules and reports.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <p>As a Lead Planner \u002F Scheduler your responsibilities will as-required basis.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>Provide inputs to various project\u002Fprogram level reports.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>Seated in a project office, work as part of a project team.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>Develop and maintain cooperative work relationships with the internal project team members and the external entities such as clients, partners, and Contractors.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>Manage the relationships between the scheduling, estimating, cost control, and risk management for a project and program.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> <p><i>Our People &amp; Places Solutions business – reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomizes the \"why\" of what we do – the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole. From facilities delivering life-saving therapies and ensuring clean water to enabling the connection of people through all modes of transportation and providing access to technology – we're integrating a multitude of these solution elements to build the smart environments of tomorrow.<\u002Fi><br> <br> <i>Start your Jacobs career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <br> \n <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> At Jacobs, we push the limits of what’s possible so we can improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomize the \"why\" of what we do – the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole.<\u002Fp> \n <p>We are looking for an experienced and collaborative Project Manager – Submittals who can perform in a fast paced, high-energy environment, supporting and assisting through all project delivery phases for a large regional commuter transit project. The main phases of the project include Preliminary Design, Detail Design, Construction, Commissioning and Contract Administration.<\u002Fp> \n <p>You’ll work under the direction of the Senior Project Manager and\u002For the Design Manager with minimal supervision. In this position you’ll ultimately be responsible for the management and coordination of project submittals.<\u002Fp> \n <p>The successful candidate must have thorough knowledge and understand the objectives in contract administration systems (i.e., Unifier, CM 14 and ProjectWise) and related regulatory and\u002For industry requirements and practices with progressive experience ideally within transit infrastructure projects. You’ll also provide support to coordinating stakeholders and technical design consultant requests.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Bring your curiosity, talent for multi-tasking, and extreme organizational skills and we’ll help you grow, pursue and fulfill what drives you – so we can make big impacts on the world, together.<br> <\u002Fp>\n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <ul>\n  <li><br> Reporting to the Senior Project Manager and\u002For Design Manager the position is responsible for the management of the project submittals process<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Supports Design Manager, Senior Project Manager and the project team as required<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Highly organized and ability to process and efficiently manage numerous submittals effectively and positively influence Client and Stakeholder team members.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Reviews and responds to project and program correspondence with excellent written and presentation skills.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Able to interact with senior clients and articulate complex concepts in a clear and concise manner.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Coordinates with document control team across all submittal related activities.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Able to lead and guide other members of the submittals review team through the review process.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Attendance at multiple technical and commercial project working groups.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Verify and maintain information received from various sources in support of stakeholder requirements, design\u002Fconstruction\u002Fcommissioning submissions, studies, meeting minutes, action logs, dashboards, registers etc. are.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> o collated,\n <br> o Track submittals to completion accordance with the timescale requirements,\n <br> o Maintain documentation of activities\n <br> o Reviewed for technical soundness\u002Fcompliance with requirement, conflicting requirements and or comments,\n <br> o Organized and kept up to date,\n <br> o Coordinated between all Stakeholder and project team\n <br> \n <ul>\n  <li>Process submittals from Client and Stakeholder teams including but not limited to the Technical Advisor (TA) and Project Co.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Interfaces with TA and Stakeholder teams on submittals issues to drive positive outcomes.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Resolves submittals and related issues providing recommendations to the project team where required.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Coordinate project team responses for technical memos etc.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Positive influencing skills and building excellent relationships.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Analyze and mitigate risk of delayed submittals and the impact on the project schedule.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Prepare summary reports for Executive Management.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>May be required to support on various project management activities.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <div>\n  You’ll also need:\n  <br> \n  <ul>\n   <li>BS or MS graduate of an engineering discipline or similar applicable technical discipline.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Minimum of 5 years’ experience working on a major transit or linear infrastructure project in a design or submittals related role<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Professional Engineer, PMP or similar professional license is considered desirable but not essential.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Project delivery experience using AFP, P3, or similar methodology is desirable. Sound understanding of project management principles is highly desirable.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Understanding of design and construction ideally including transit infrastructure is an asset (e.g., stops\u002Fstations and their associated facilities, tunnels, and systems).<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Sound understanding and practical experience of contract administration and document management software, CM14 and Aconex are desired<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Knowledge of transit engineering, operations, and maintenance is desirable<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Experience of engineering design management and review would be an asset<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Highly proficient with Microsoft Suite with a strong emphasis on Excel, and PowerPoint. <p><i>Our People &amp; Places Solutions business – reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomizes the \"why\" of what we do – the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole. From facilities delivering life-saving therapies and ensuring clean water to enabling the connection of people through all modes of transportation and providing access to technology – we're integrating a multitude of these solution elements to build the smart environments of tomorrow.<\u002Fi><br> <br> <i>Start your Jacobs career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <br> \n <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> At Jacobs, we push the limits of what’s possible so we can improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomize the \"why\" of what we do – the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole.<\u002Fp> \n <p>We have an exciting opportunity for a <b>Senior Conveyance Project Manager<\u002Fb> based to work on exciting and engaging large-scale infrastructure projects. In this role you will have the chance to manage linear infrastructure projects, watermain, sewer, distribution networks, tunnels, rehabilitation projects of varying size and complexity. Working with other members of the team, you will act as one of the company's prime contacts with the client and are responsible for the management of quality, budget, scope and schedule as well as technical performance on the project, work closely with the business group project delivery leadership or other senior project manager \u002Foperations leaders who provide oversight and mentoring.<br> <br> During your time with us, you will lead and manage the project team through all phases of project planning, execution, and closeout, consistent with established project delivery processes to meet the scope, schedule, budget and other specified requirements stated in the contract, act as a technical resource for a variety of water sanitary and storm water systems, as well as actively involved in business development activities leading to the award of contract, which includes client relationship development, project-specific positioning activities, proposal preparation, oral presentation, and contract negotiation consistent with established business development processes.<\u002Fp> \n <p><i>You will be working mainly from home (unless you prefer coming into one of our offices), with the expectation to travel for client \u002Fsite meetings and occasional team meetings.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp> \n <p>We are invested in you and your success. Our values stand on a foundation of safety, integrity, inclusion and diversity. We put people at the heart of our business and we truly believe that by supporting one another through our culture of caring, we all succeed. We value positive mental health and a sense of belonging for all employees. We aim to make inclusion and diversity core attributes of our identity, embedded in all our employment and business practices in all locations. We know that if we are inclusive, we’re more connected, and if we are diverse, we’re more creative.<br> <br> As a Disability Confident employer, we will interview all disabled applicants who meet the minimum criteria for a vacancy. We welcome applications from candidates who are seeking flexible working and from those who may not meet all the listed requirements for a role.<br> Bring your curiosity, passion for creativity, and multi-tasking skills in a fast-paced environment. We’ll help you grow, pursue and fulfill what inspires you – so we can make big impacts on the world, together.<\u002Fp> \n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <ul>\n  <li><br> Bachelor’s degree in years’ of relevant experience<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Previous demonstrated experience managing municipal conveyance projects<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <div>\n  The ideal candidate will possess the following skills and experience:\n  <br> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Strong theoretical knowledge and experience in sewer (combined, wastewater, and\u002For storm applications) and watermain design, hydraulic design, design of hydraulic and flow control structures<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Significant experience in planning, risk management, schedule development and control, work monitoring and cost control of design and construction projects<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Significant experience in preliminary design, detailed design and contract administration \u002Fconstruction management of municipal conveyance projects using open cut and trenchless construction techniques<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Significant experience of local, provincial and federal regulatory permits and approval requirements associated with municipal conveyance projects<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Significant experience in obtaining permits, approvals and easements for municipal conveyance projects including storm water management facilities, trunk sewers and feedermains<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Significant experience with property requirements, utility and agency coordination for municipal conveyance projects<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Familiarity with specialty hydraulics including computational fluid dynamics, air movement in sewers, complex inflow, drop structure and transient analysis construction methods<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Proven experience leading and managing project teams on consulting projects<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Excellent time management and organizational skills<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Excellent report writing skills<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Completion of
